subject.title: GIMP 2.7.4
subject.description: If you want to start creating your own images or editing photos in GIMP, but you are not sure how to go about it, these tutorials will show you the way. This training course will introduce you to the basic functions in GIMP, including how to download the program, how to create a new document, and how to add color. You will also find out how to edit your photographs, remove the red eye effect, use layers, and even modify your keyboard shortcuts.

subject.title: Windows Contacts for Windows 7
subject.description: Windows Contacts is a contact manager, which you can use to store personal and professional details of your contacts. You can add a variety of different information types, including email, postal addresses, telephone numbers, and even contact photos. You can also create groups to facilitate your contact organization and facilitate bulk email communications.

subject.title: WordPad for Windows 7
subject.description: Windows 7 comes complete with its own simplified word processing program, called WordPad. It has fewer tools than Microsoft's flagship word processor, Word, but can still be used to create, format, and print text documents. Find out how to insert text using WordPad, how to adjust the color and text formatting, and how to save and print your documents.

subject.title: Paint for Windows 7
subject.description: Paint is a very basic drawing program that comes with Windows 7. Via the ribbon interface, you can insert a variety of different shapes and lines and customize your pen and color options. You can also use the display settings to adjust the zoom settings, activate rulers and gridlines, and view your image in full screen mode.

subject.title: Lotus Notes 8.5
subject.description: This series of tutorials will show you how to begin accessing your email in Lotus Notes 8.5 and how to read and send messages. You will also find out how to add and organize your contacts, how to add new entries for your calendar, and how to create to do tasks. These tutorials will introduce you to and help you get to grips with the key components of the Lotus Notes 8.5 organizer and email client.

subject.title: Word 2010
subject.description: This training course will show you how to use Word 2010. You will soon learn that this program is very useful for typing out a letter, a report or a paper. Find out how to enter text, how to format it, and also how to insert other elements into your document, including charts, illustrations and diagrams. This training course will also show you how to use Word 2010's advanced settings, including creating an index, summary management and the Mail Merge functions.

subject.title: Excel 2010
subject.description: This training course will show you how to use Office 2010's spreadsheet program, Excel 2010. Learn how to use Excel to add data to your workbook, edit and format your entries and even perform calculations. Find out how to use more complex tools, such as PivotTables, advanced formulae and dropdown menus... You will soon be able to use Excel 2010 to manage your accounts, create professional reports and much, much more!

subject.title: PowerPoint 2010
subject.description: This training course on PowerPoint 2010 will teach you how to use the program to create your presentations. You will see how to insert slides and add the various elements, including text boxes, images, charts and tables. You will also learn how to make your document more presentable, using animations, transitions and themes.

subject.title: Outlook 2010
subject.description: This training course will show you how to use the Outlook 2010 email client. Not only will you learn how to send and receive emails, but you will also find out that Outlook comes complete with an address book, events calendar and to-do list. These tutorials will also show you how to configure your account using POP or IMAP, how to change the settings for your email reception and how to create a mailout.

subject.title: Google Earth 7
subject.description: Explore the world and outer space from your computer using Google Earth. You'll be able to travel across country borders and customize your maps to display information like landmarks, borders and major roads. See how to get practical information like finding a restaurant in a certain part of town or have fun using the space exploration or flight simulator modes. Discover how to navigate between the satellite and street views and easy move from location to location.

subject.title: Picasa 3.8
subject.description: This series of tutorials will show you everything you need to know about using Google's photo management software, Picasa 3.8. This package allows you to organize, edit, and share the photos stored on your computer. Find out how to create photo collages and film presentations, remove the red eye effect from photos, and share your photos with your friends and family via the internet.

subject.title: OneNote 2010
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to OneNote 2010, an organizer program produced by Microsoft which allows you to create notes and manage your projects. Over the course of these tutorials, you will get to grips with the key functionalities of OneNote 2010, including tags, sections, a powerful search function, and collaborating with other users online.

subject.title: Visio 2010
subject.description: This series of tutorials will show you how to use Microsoft Visio 2010. Visio 2010 is a diagram creation software program which features a huge number of different shapes and tools. Using this program, you can to create a wide range of diagrams, including floor plans, maps, company organization diagrams, and network outlines. These tutorials will also show you how to associate pre-existing data with your diagram, and create links between your diagram and different types of file.

subject.title: Project 2010
subject.description: This series of tutorials will show you how to use Microsoft's project management software application, called Project 2010. Part of the extended Office 2010 family, Project 2010 allows you to manage the professional or indeed personal projects that you have on the go. Using the application, you can break your projects down into different tasks which can then be adjusted, managed, and tracked individually, allowing you to keep your project on course. It is easy to set deadlines and constraints for particular tasks, and you can create and add resources in order to manage how you are going to complete your tasks and how long they are going to take. In these tutorials, you will also learn how to use tools such as the Level Resource function - which can help you resolve schedule and resource conflicts - the calendar display view, and summary reports.

subject.title: Publisher 2010
subject.description: This series of tutorials will show you how to begin creating professional documents in Microsoft Publisher 2010. Publisher 2010 is extremely useful and can be used to create different types of document, including business cards, invitations, and calendars. At the end of this training course, you will also know how to export your documents in a variety of different formats, how to send it using email, and how to prepare your document for printing.

subject.title: InfoPath 2010
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the key principles for creating your own forms in InfoPath 2010, an extremely useful tool for building highly customizable surveys and questionnaires. This program, which comes as part of the extended Office 2010 suite, enables you to insert a variety of different elements, including data entry fields, drop-down menus, check boxes, and action buttons. You will also find out how to rearrange the different elements in your form, how to activate it, and how to share it with other users.

subject.title: Access 2010
subject.description: Are you having trouble getting to grips with your database? This training course on Access 2010 will help you out! In this series of tutorials, you will learn how to create and manage your database. You will find out how to organize your data into tables, how to create data entry forms, and how to edit your field properties. You will also learn how to create relationships between different fields in order to connect different records in multiple tables. Finally, you will learn how to extract your data in different forms, using PivotTables, PivotCharts, and queries.

subject.title: iTunes 10
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to iTunes 10 for your PC. iTunes 10 is a free media player that can organize and playback your music tracks, videos and podcasts. This training course will show you how to import music into your library, transfer your media files to an iPhone or iPod, and how to create your own Apple account in order to take advantage of the numerous additional iTunes services. You will also find out how to download a music track from the iTunes Store, how to use Ping, and how to share your music.

subject.title: Gmail
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to all the functionalities available via the Gmail and Google Calendar services. You will learn how to create your own account, how to sign in to Gmail, and how to begin sending and receiving emails. You will also find out how to use Gmail to manage, sort, and find your emails. It is also easy to organize your address book, which comes complete with an integrated search function. These contact entries can be edited, downloaded, and shared. Using Gmail and Google Calendar in tandem allows you to add structure to your daily life, plan events and meetings, and even invite individuals to participate or attend.

subject.title: Google Docs 2014
subject.description: This series of tutorials will take you through all the key tools in Google Document, the word-processing application offered as part of the Google Drive office suite. Based entirely online, Google Document allows you to create and format a text-based document in no time at all. As well as creating documents from scratch using the service, you can also import files that you have already created using another program - such as Open Office or Microsoft Word - and work on it in Google Document. These video tutorials will also show you how to insert images, including charts, photographs, and customized diagrams. You can even add interactivity to the document with the insertion of hyperlinks and bookmarks. And once you have finished your document, you can share it with your colleagues via email, publish it on the internet, or even invite others to participate in its creation with you using the share tools. The integrated comments system will help you to discuss your document and ensure that it really is the product of your combined efforts.

subject.title: Flickr
subject.description: Flicker is an online photo and video management and sharing service. You can choose who you would like to share your photos with by choosing a Privacy Setting for each of your publications. You can edit all aspects of your photos like the title, description, date and tags. If you have a lot of photos, you can organize them into albums and collections. You can also interact with other Flickr members by following, commenting and sharing photos or videos. Creating a gallery about a certain topic lets other members discover your personal interests. You can join groups to share and discuss around a common theme. You will also see how to customize your settings for your Flickr account regarding your publications, notifications and privacy.

subject.title: Windows 7
subject.description: Microsoft has made a number of changes to the latest version of its Windows operating system, Windows 7. This series of tutorials will take you through all the major (and less-known) tools, including how to access your documents via the Computer window, how to adjust the system's configuration settings using the Control Panel, and how to create multiple user accounts for a single computer. These tutorials will also introduce you to the major changes that have been made, such as interactive thumbnail previews in the taskbar, new desktop gadgets, and new interfaces for Windows-standard programs such as Paint and WordPad.

subject.title: Firefox 4
subject.description: Whether you're a beginner or an experienced user of another internet browser, this series of tutorials will introduce you to all the key aspects of Firefox 4. This version of Mozilla's open-source, entirely-free browser is extremely powerful, features added security measures, and can be customized in numerous different ways. Of particular interest to users is the ever-growing database of extensions which can be downloaded from the internet and installed in your browser, effectively allowing you to adapt Firefox 4 to suit your needs and preferences. With this series of tutorials, you will find out how to use Tab Groups, bookmark backups, use Firefox 4's keyboard shortcuts, and save and print copies of your favorite websites.

subject.title: Google Chrome 11
subject.description: With this series of tutorials, you will find out how use to the Google Chrome internet browser. As well as the standard features found in all the leading browsers on the market (such as Firefox and Internet Explorer), you will also learn how to use some of the special tools unique to Chrome, such as Google Cloud Print, which allows you to share your printer with other users via your Google account. The Chrome browser is extremely fast and powerful, and can be customized with extensions, themes, and applications downloaded from the Chrome webstore. In the webstore, you will find extensions allowing you to add RSS feeds or add Internet Explorer- or Firefox-specific features. And for those of you interested in accessing your personal data on different devices, your personal settings can be saved via your Google account and then imported into any device running the Chrome browser.

subject.title: Internet Explorer 9
subject.description: This collection of tutorials on Internet Explorer 9 will show you how to get to grips with version nine of Microsoft's internet browser, currently the most popular browser in the world. Learn the basics of browsing the internet, find out how to speed up your browsing with handy shortcuts and advice on configuring your browser, and get to know the wealth of security options designed to make your surfing a safer and happier one. Internet Explorer 9 is above all concerned with making it easy to customize your browser, with not only favorites and handy toolbars, but also Web Slices and RSS feeds, which allow you to keep on top of the latest developments and additions to your favorite websites.

subject.title: Google Drive 2013
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce the functionalities offered by Google Drive. The interface allows the user to access the five applications offered by Google Drive. From the list view, the user can create text documents (Google Document), spreadsheets (Google Spreadsheet), visual presentations combining text and graphics (Google Presentation), forms (Google Forms), and diagrams and images (Google Drawing). It is also possible to access an extensive gallery of pre-formatted templates: users can even create and share their own customized templates. Over the course of this series of tutorials, you will learn how to navigate within the portal, how to sort your documents, and how to locate specific documents using the powerful search function. The list view can also be used to modify the share settings for a particular document.

subject.title: Google Sheets 2014
subject.description: These tutorials will introduce you to Google Spreadsheet and its numerous toolsets and operations. You will find out how to enter and modify your data, as well as how to classify, sort, and filter your entries once you have inserted them into your worksheet. Your spreadsheet also functions as an extremely powerful calculator, allowing you to perform complex mathematical equations and analytical operations relating to your data. Google Spreadsheet also features a number of different tools that can help you to manipulate, reorganize, and present your data, including pivot table reports, graphical charts and heat maps. Google Spreadsheet being a highly collaborative application, these tutorials will also show you how to share your documents online with your work collaborators, and how to work with others on a single document at the same time.

subject.title: Google Drawing
subject.description: This training course will introduce you to Google Drawing, Google Drive's diagram creation application. In this series of tutorials, you will learn how to create and manipulate various shapes and lines, how to customize these shapes using the color, effect, and style settings, and how to use your diagrams in other documents. You will also find out how to import images from your hard-drive and edit them using Google Drawing.

subject.title: Google Slides 2014
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to Google Slides and all of its tools and functions. This application, which is similar in function to Microsoft PowerPoint and is available through Google Drive, allows you to create presentation documents and slide shows. These can prove very useful when you have a visual or oral presentation to give in front of an audience. Google Slides enables you to create your slides and organize them into a slide show. There are many different tools that you can use to create your slides and the elements that you add. You can insert images, charts, and even videos. You can also create text boxes, diagrams, and tables. There is also a large selection of tools that you can use to adjust your slide backgrounds, overall theme, and color settings, thereby improving the appearance of your presentation.

subject.title: Facebook 2014
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the Facebook social networking service. Find out how to create and customize your profile, how to create a network of friends, and how to begin interacting with other users. You will also learn how to use Facebook to share your photos or to create and organize events. Facebook can also be used to manage the online presence and visibility of your company, association or project.

subject.title: Twitter 2016
subject.description: This training course will introduce you to all the different services and functions offered by Twitter, the social networking and microblogging website. As well as short messages - known as tweets - users can also post videos and images within the Twitter ecosystem. Twitter can also be used to follow updates and news stories that are posted by journalists, politicians, film stars, athletes, and musicians. The more you use Twitter, the more your feed will become filled with messages: it is therefore extremely important to know how to organize and filter your tweets. Twitter also features a powerful search engine, a list function, and an option to include your location in your tweets.

subject.title: LibreOffice Writer 3.5
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers the tools and functions that you will need to get the most out of LibreOffice Writer. You will find out how to create and format complex and varied text-based documents. You will also learn how to insert illustrations, create charts and diagrams, and add text boxes. LibreOffice Writer can generate detailed reference elements, such as tables of contents, indexes, and even an extensive bibliographical database. As well as text documents, you will also find out how to create your own envelopes and mail-merge emails. Finally, you will learn how to get to grips with and customize the different toolbars, keyboard shortcuts, and menus featured in LibreOffice Writer.

subject.title: Windows 8
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to Windows 8, the new operating system developed by Microsoft and available in various forms since March 2012. The biggest change to the Windows operating system is the new Start Screen, which is accessed via a separate distinct interface, sometimes referred to as Metro. The new Start Screen figures as the Windows 8 home page.  Each application or folder appears in the form of a tile. The Start Screen is easy to customize, and the user can quickly create new tiles to link to applications, folders, and even websites. The interface, which is optimized for touch-screen devices, allows users to move between different screens and tabbed applications. You will find out how to move from one open program to another, how to create user accounts, and how to log in and out of your user session. The File Explorer has also evolved to incorporate a systems ribbon by which its different tools and functions can be accessed. In these tutorials, you will find out how to get to grips with the key changes that have been made to this new version of Windows.This training course was produced primarily on Windows 8. For a number of newer tutorials, however - including notably how to use the Start Screen in Windows 8.1 - Windows 8.1 was used.

subject.title: Thunderbird 12
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the functionalities and tools available in Thunderbird 12. You will learn how to send and receive emails, how to manage your address book, and how to add events to your calendar. You will also find out how to adjust your account settings (using POP and IMAP setups), how to filter out junk mail, and how to create automatic replies.

subject.title: WebEx 2012
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers the key functionalities offered by the WebEx online conferencing service. WebEx allows you to create and organize online meeting, invite individuals to participate, and specify the date and time of the event. You can manage your online meetings using the WebEx calendar, and once the meeting has begun, you can adjust participation levels, annotate your own diagrams, share your desktop and applications, and even transfer files. It is also possible to interact with other participants via webcam or the instant messaging function. Many of the documents or elements created during your meeting can be saved to your hard-drive and accessed later.

subject.title: Google Services
subject.description: This training course will introduce you to a number of different services offered by Google. As well as learning how to perform a search using the Google search engine, you will also find out how to create an advanced search, perform calculations using the search field, or even find sport results quickly and easily. You can also specify exactly what sort of type of content you are looking for (including images, videos and addresses). Google Scholar is a specialist search engine that can be used to return article citations and full texts, whereas Google Books can help you find publications that have been digitized. The course also includes a series of tutorials on Google Maps, including how to find an address, how to use the route finder to get directions between two points, and how to explore a location using the Street View mode. You can read the latest news stories with Google News. Google also features a range of translation services which can be used to translate words, phrases, documents or entire websites.

subject.title: Google Chrome 31
subject.description: In this course you'll learn how to use Google Chrome and all its features. You'll recognize the tools you're used to interacting with in other browsers, but you'll also learn all about the specific features in Chrome. You'll be able to customize your browser using downloadable themes and extensions available from the Chrome Web Store. In addition, you will also learn how to use your RSS feeds and check your email. For more advanced users, Chrome offers the ability to, through use of a Google account, sync devices and take advantage of online printing.

subject.title: Skype 5.9
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the key features of Skype 5.9. You will first of all learn how to install the application and create your own user account. You will then find out how to navigate using the interface and how to use the application's different tools. Skype 5.9 allows you to very quickly add individuals to your contacts list using their username, their email address or just their first and surname. You can communicate with these contacts via instant messages, voice chat and even video calls. Skype 5.9 also includes the option to share your desktop with your contact, as well as a voicemail feature and call forwarding.

subject.title: Acrobat Reader DC
subject.description: In this course you'll see how to use the program Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. From opening a document to transferring elements and changing your settings you'll become better acquainted with Acrobat Reader DC. Discover how to fill in forms, add a signature and customize your Acrobat Reader interface. Now with Acrobat Reader DC, you can create an Adobe ID and upload your documents directly to Adobe's online document cloud services.

subject.title: LibreOffice Calc 3.5
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to LibreOffice Calc, the spreadsheet component of the LibreOffice suite. You can use spreadsheets to store, sort, filter and analyze data entries. You can also use them to present the data that you have inserted in the form of a table, chart or pivot table. The data that you insert will most often be numerical, but you can insert many different types of information into your spreadsheet, including text, hyperlinks, dates and currencies. Although LibreOffice Calc is free to download and use, it is also compatible with Microsoft Excel. You can save your spreadsheets in a variety of different formats, including ODF (OpenDocument format), XLS, CSV and PDF. LibreOffice Calc also enables you to perform both simple and complex calculations using formulae. These formulae are constructed using calculation-specific code names and in many cases cell references. You can use formulae to add numbers together, analyze a data list to return an average, calculate the interest on a loan, and even automatically insert data into a table. LibreOffice Calc also comes complete with a number of different tools that can help you to work with other users on a single document. As well as being able to email your document using the integrated email function, you can also leave comments and compare different versions of the same document.

subject.title: LibreOffice Impress 3.5
subject.description: LibreOffice Impress 3.5 is a slide show application that can be used to create and deliver presentations. In this series of tutorials, you will find out how to create a presentation, how to add slides, how to insert text-elements, shapes and multimedia files, and how to animate objects. You will also learn how to get the most out of the different tools and functionalities offered by LibreOffice Impress.

subject.title: OpenOffice Writer 3.4
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers the tools and functions that you will need to get the most out of Apache OpenOffice Writer 3.4. You will find out how to create and format complex and varied text-based documents. You will also learn how to insert illustrations, create charts and diagrams, and add text boxes. OpenOffice Writer 3.4 can generate detailed reference elements, such as tables of contents, indexes, and even an extensive bibliographical database. As well as text documents, you will also find out how to create your own envelopes and mail-merge emails. You will learn how to get to grips with and customise the different toolbars, keyboard shortcuts, and menus featured in OpenOffice Writer 3.4. Finally, you will also find a tutorial to guide you through the differences in interface between OpenOffice Writer and LibreOffice Writer.

subject.title: OpenOffice Calc 3.4
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to OpenOffice Calc, the spreadsheet component of the OpenOffice suite. You can use spreadsheets to store, sort, filter and analyze data entries. You can also use them to present the data that you have inserted in the form of a table, chart or pivot table. The data that you insert will most often be numerical, but you can insert many different types of information into your spreadsheet, including text, hyperlinks, dates and currencies. Although OpenOffice Calc is free to download and use, it is also compatible with Microsoft Excel. You can save your spreadsheets in a variety of different formats, including ODF (OpenDocument format), XLS, CSV and PDF. OpenOffice Calc also enables you to perform both simple and complex calculations using formulae. These formulae are constructed using calculation-specific code names and in many cases cell references. You can use formulae to add numbers together, analyze a data list to return an average, calculate the interest on a loan, and even automatically insert data into a table. OpenOffice Calc also comes complete with a number of different tools that can help you to work with other users on a single document. As well as being able to email your document using the integrated email function, you can also leave comments and compare different versions of the same document. Finally, you will also find a tutorial to guide you through the differences in interface between OpenOffice Calc and LibreOffice Calc.

subject.title: OpenOffice Impress 3.4
subject.description: Apache OpenOffice Impress 3.5 is a slide show application that can be used to create and deliver presentations. In this series of tutorials, you will find out how to create a presentation, how to add slides, how to insert text-elements, shapes and multimedia files, and how to animate objects. You will also learn how to get the most out of the different tools and functionalities offered by OpenOffice Impress. Finally, you will also find a tutorial to guide you through the differences in interface between OpenOffice Impress and LibreOffice Impress.

subject.title: Outlook 2013
subject.description: Outlook 2013 is an email client which can be used to read and reply to emails and manage multiple accounts. If you receive a lot of emails, then you can use Outlook to organize them into folders and subfolders and find them again with the powerful search tool. Outlook 2013 also allows you to set up automatic actions and tasks which can be used to remove junk mail from your inbox or transfer emails from a certain sender to a specified folder. It also comes complete with an address book for managing your contact entries and creating mailing groups, as well as a task list for organizing your to do list. The Outlook 2013 calendar is also extremely useful for keeping on top of your appointments and other events, and for organizing meetings with your work colleagues.

subject.title: Excel 2013
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Excel 2013, the spreadsheet application released as part of the New Office. This spreadsheet application can be used to organize a wide variety of different data types, including text, numbers, percentages, dates, monetary figures, and even hyperlinks. You can create tables, adjust their appearance, and filter and sort your data entries. You can even begin to analyze and summarize your data by adding subtotals. Excel 2013 can be used to analyze and present your data in many different ways. You can use a variety of different chart types to create graphical representations of your data values, and you can change the way in which your entries are analyzed using PivotTables. Excel 2013 also features a number of new tools, including Flash Fill, which can be used to automatically add data to your table. Spreadsheet applications are extremely useful for performing calculations with your data: Excel 2013 comes complete with a huge library of formulae and functions. These can be used to perform calculations with varying degrees of complexity. You can incorporate conditions, apply different methods of analysis, and even extract individual cell elements to be used elsewhere in your spreadsheet. Excel 2013 also features a whole suite of collaboration tools intended to stimulate shared working practices. You can send your documents via email, protect them and convert them into different file formats, and even upload them to your cloud storage space. Shared access to these documents can also be activated, and access links can be created with ease. Working with other users on the same document is also optimized, with advanced comment-leaving and change-tracking facilities all available in Excel 2013.

subject.title: OneNote 2013
subject.description: OneNote 2013, a note-taking tool and organizer, is part of the Office 2013 suite and is perfect for managing your projects. This training course will show you how to create a new notebook, add a variety of different types of notes, links, and illustrations, and even annotate your pages using the drawing tools. You will also find out how to share your notebook, how to print it out, and even how to send certain pages via email.This training course was produced, in parts, using SkyDrive and SkyDrive Pro. These services have since become OneDrive and OneDrive for Business, respectively. Their features have not, however, changed.

subject.title: Visio 2013
subject.description: You can create all kinds of different charts and diagrams with Microsoft Visio 2013. To simplify this process, you'll find a multitude of stencils with pre-made shapes for business, IT, and architectural diagrams, to name a few. We'll see how to create a company diagram, an office floor plan, or a city map. First, we'll see how to insert and organize the different pages of your Visio file. Then we'll explore more complex possibilities, such as inserting text and images into your diagram or adding charts and spreadsheets to your presentation. You can then personalize your display options and change the appearance of your diagrams using themes and Quick Styles. With Visio 2013 you can use import data from other kinds of files, and you can create specific reports based on the content of your charts. This software also lends itself to collaboration, with shortcuts to email, online publishing, and comments.

subject.title: Project 2013
subject.description: In this training course, you will see how to use Microsoft's project management software application, called Project 2013. Part of the extended Office 2013 family, Project 2013 helps you manage multiple professional or personal projects at the same time. Using the application, you can break your projects down into different tasks which can then be adjusted, managed, and tracked individually, allowing you to keep your project on course. We'll see how to set deadlines and constraints for particular tasks, as well as add resources or manage the duration and the progress of your tasks. In these tutorials, we'll also see how to use tools such as the task inspector, automatically generated reports, and sharing options.

subject.title: Word 2013
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Word 2013, the word processing application released as part of the New Office. This word processor can be used to create and format complex text documents. You can use paragraph styles, templates and document themes to change the appearance of your document. Word 2013 also includes a number of tools that can speed up the creation of reference items in your document, such as bibliographies, indexes and tables of contents. You can even create your own envelopes and labels and automatically insert addresses and contact details using the Mailing tools. If you have data that you want to include in your text document, you can create tables and charts. You can also make text stand out with a variety of different title tools and special effects. Some of the newest and most advanced features available in Word 2013 are the sharing and online storage options. You can save your files online using your SharePoint or OneDrive storage spaces, making them accessible from any device with an internet connection. You can also edit them online, share them instantly with other users, and even work together on the same document.

subject.title: PowerPoint 2013
subject.description: PowerPoint 2013 is part of the 2013 edition of Microsoft's Office suite and allows user to create and organize their presentations and slide shows. PowerPoint 2013 also features specialized presenter tools and modes to help the user deliver their presentation successfully. In PowerPoint 2013, users can insert text boxes, illustrations - such as images, tables and charts - and even multimedia files. PowerPoint 2013 also comes complete with a number of preset and customizable themes as well as transitions and animations, all of which can be used to change the appearance of the entire presentation or individual slides. PowerPoint 2013 is also optimized for collaborative working: users can send their presentation to colleagues using the integrated email function, leave comments and add annotations to a slide, or store and share their file online.

subject.title: Linkedin 2014
subject.description: LinkedIn is a social networking website aimed at users looking to develop their professional profile and contacts. Once you have created your user account, you can find and create connections with people you know or have worked with by sending them invitations. Users can also view new job announcements and find, target and save particular candidature profiles. It's even possible to create a company page and related showcase pages to publicize businesses. LinkedIn also encourages users to share ideas and participate in discussions on different subjects via the group function.

subject.title: Yammer
subject.description: Yammer is a professional social network that can be used to improve collaboration and communication within your company. As long as an employee has a company email address, they can join the Yammer network. It is easy to share messages and files via the network. Users can also communicate through a variety of different tools, including updates, private messages. You can create surveys using the poll tool or work on documents in real time with other users. You can even create external networks to collaborate and communicate with non-company users, such as customers, clients, or partners.

subject.title: Access 2013
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers the key tools and features that you will use in Access 2013, the database management program that comes with certain versions of the Office 2013 suite. This training course will show you how to create a new database file, how to add data tables to store your records, and how to begin organizing and formatting your data values. You can make it easier to add new values to your data tables by creating forms. Once you have added some data, you can begin to summarize, analyze and cross reference it using queries and calculations. And if you want to visualize or print out your data entries, you can create your own reports. You can even export your data in a variety of different formats, which can be then be opened and manipulated in a completely different program.

subject.title: Evernote 5.1
subject.description: Evernote is an organizational software program that allows you to take and save notes in text, image and audio form. This course will cover how to take notes in all these formats, while the latter part will cover how to insert images, tables and files into your notes. Since Evernote understands the importance of teamwork, they've made it quite easy to share your notes with your colleagues, friends and family. Learn how to share your notes via email, social networking and, if you have a Business account, your Business Library.

subject.title: OneDrive for Business
subject.description: OneDrive for Business is the storage space that comes as part of your Office 365 SharePoint area. It is primarily used to store files online  meaning that you can access them from anywhere as long as you have an internet connection. It can also be used with the Office Online suite or a locally installed version of Office to create and edit documents. You can, for example, create Excel spreadsheets and surveys, Word documents, OneNote notebooks, and PowerPoint presentations. Once a document is available online, you can share it with other users, in or outside of your company. You can decide whether the users with whom you have shared the files can simply view them or benefit from full editing permissions.

subject.title: SharePoint 2013
subject.description: SharePoint 2013 is a browser-based platform designed to encourage and support collaboration between company coworkers. It is available entirely online or integrated into your company's intranet, and can be used in conjunction with Office 365. Regardless of the delivery method, SharePoint comes with a number of key features, including a newsfeed, the OneDrive for Business file storage space, and Sites. This training course will introduce you to all these different features and show you how to navigate between the different components once you have signed in to the service. The newsfeed is SharePoint's social hub, which can be used to track user activity on the network and stay up to date on the latest changes to documents and sites. Individuals can create their own user profile and share news and announcements via the conversation tools. SharePoint also includes the Sites component, which allows users to create internal sites for centralizing work on a particular project or in a specific department. These sites can be customized in a number of different ways, including through the addition of apps, libraries and lists, and the modification of the site's theme, color scheme and font style. To do lists can be created, tasks managed and completed, and projects tracked. File storage can be done via document or image libraries, and certain file types - such as text documents, spreadsheets and presentations - can be edited online using the Office Web Apps suite. Individuals can also use OneNote to create their own online notebooks associated with particular sites or accounts. If users have been granted administrator privileges, they can edit, customize and manage the SharePoint platform itself. Finally, companies looking to create an informative outward-facing online location for their brand can use the public site function. All of this is available via SharePoint 2013.

subject.title: Word Online
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the key features of Word Online, part of Microsoft's Office Online suite. Word Online is a free online version of Word, accessible via OneDrive and Office 365. The app can be used to create and format your text documents. Once you have created a document, you can save it online and access it from any device with an internet connection. It is also possible to keep track of earlier versions of your documents. You can change the appearance of your text with the format tools: these allow you to adjust the color, alignment and even styles of any text items that you have added. Another key feature of Word Online is the ability to collaborate with other users on the same document, online and in real time. With the document stored in the cloud, it is also very easy to share your documents with your colleagues and friends.

subject.title: Excel Online
subject.description: This training course covers Excel Online, the online version of Excel 2013, Microsoft's spreadsheet editing application. Workbooks that have been stored online in your OneDrive for Business or SharePoint storage area can be opened, viewed and edited using Excel Online. Although Excel Online does not have all the features that come as part of Excel 2013, it is still powerful enough to help you do a lot of your calculations and data entry tasks. You can add and format multiple types of data, including numerical and monetary values, percentages, dates and text-based entries. You can even insert hyperlinks. Data entries can also be converted into tables, which can then be used to sort and filter your values. It is even possible to create a variety of different charts online, which can help you to analyze and present your data in graphic form. As with Excel 2013, Excel Online also features a huge number of formulae, including simple calculations, conditional constructions and more complex analytical functions. Finally, Excel Online can also be used to collaborate with colleagues and friends online, on the same document, at the same time.

subject.title: PowerPoint Online
subject.description: This training course will introduce you to PowerPoint Online, a free online version of PowerPoint that comes as part of Microsoft's Office Online suite. It is accessed via Microsoft Office Online, your OneDrive or Office 365 web portal, and can be used to create and edit presentations. It includes a number of standard PowerPoint features, including the ability to create and manipulate different presentation elements - such as text boxes, shapes, images, and graphics - alter your presentation's overall design with themes, and even add animations and transitions to your slides. It is also possible for multiple users to edit the same presentation file together, online and in real-time. Authors and editors can also leave comments to create conversation threads associated with the presentation file. The presentation is saved online, in your cloud storage location, which means that it can not only be accessed from any device with an internet connection, but it can also be easily shared via a variety of different web services.

subject.title: Outlook Web App
subject.description: This training course covers Outlook Web App (also known as OWA), Office 365's online email client. Once you have signed in to your Office 365 account, you can begin accessing the different Outlook Web App components: Mail, People, Calendar, and Tasks. Your email access allows you to read, write, reply to and forward your messages. You can also organize and manage your emails in different ways. You can, for example, categorize your emails using existing color codes or your own custom labels. You can also flag emails for review later on, and even create folders and favorite shortcuts to help you find you find your messages more easily. Outlook Web App also comes with an address book for organizing your contacts. This is known as People, and you can add contacts to it in a variety of different ways. You can also create contact lists to email multiple individuals via a single contact or for creating mailouts. As well as your own contacts, you will find that you have access to your company-wide directory, which stores the contact details for your coworkers. Outlook Web App also includes other means of communication: you can, for example, chat with other users via the integrated instant messenger and participate in online meetings. These meetings can be organized through Outlook Web App's Calendar component. You can also use the calendar to manage your appointments and events, and combine different schedules to keep on top of your plans. Finally, you can also manage your workload and set yourself reminders with the Task section. This combines to-do items that you have created and any emails that you have flagged.

subject.title: Lync 2013
subject.description: Lync 2013 is a Microsoft Office program that offers users a variety of communication services including instant messaging, audio and video calls, online meetings and conference call presentation features. Lync 2013 (the desktop application) and Lync Online (the online version) offer, more or less, the same communication options. This gives users the choice of connecting using the Lync 2013 desktop application, the Lync Windows Store App, iOS or a web browser via the Office 365 Cloud. This course will explain the basics, such as how to connect for the first time and how to add contacts, but it will will also go over the more advanced uses of Lync. It will cover how to use the Instant Messaging service, how to effectuate audio and video calls and how to communicate with multiple users. The calendar toolbar, which is connected to the user's Outlook 2013 account, allows for easy access to scheduled online conferences. You will learn how to connect to pre-planned conference calls and then present and/or share documents with other participants.

subject.title: OneDrive Consumer Edition
subject.description: OneDrive is an online storage service provided by Microsoft, which can be used to store, manage and edit your documents and photos. It can be opened in your internet browser and is accessible via the OneDrive.com website. It also comes as part of the Outlook.com email and organizer service and the Office.com online suite. Documents that are stored using OneDrive can be opened using Microsoft's Office Online apps: Word Online for text documents, PowerPoint Online for presentations, Excel Online for spreadsheets and OneNote Online for notebooks. Documents that have been uploaded to the OneDrive service can be shared with other users quickly and easily, allowing you to work on the same document with other individuals via the internet. You can organize your documents into folders, tag people in your photos, and sort your files using different criteria.

subject.title: Outlook Mail
subject.description: This course is an in-depth introduction to Microsoft's webmail service Outlook Mail, formally known as Outlook.com. You can access your Outlook Mail account and correspondence with contacts through bing.com, msn.com or mail.live.com. It's possible to share documents online using OneDrive, and edit them in Office Online. Outlook Mail has features that help you to automatically organize your mailbox, filter your messages and search your emails so that you can quickly locate those important conversations. There is also an address book available, which allows you to organize your work and personal contacts. Outlook Mail makes it easy to create groups of contacts, putting communication with them at your fingertips. Moreover, the calendar feature allows for the creation of events and meetings. In this course, you'll learn all about Outlook Mail's various features.

subject.title: Dropbox
subject.description: Dropbox is an online application that allows users to access files from any of their devices, as long as they are connected to the internet. You can can sync documents and then locate and edit them not only via a desktop, but also via handheld devices. That means you can use your iPad, iPhone or Andoid to view and modify the synced files. It's even possible to share the files with other users via e-mail.

subject.title: iOS 7 (iPad / iPhone)
subject.description: If you've installed iOS 7 on your iPad or iPhone, the first thing you'll notice is that it boasts a new and sleeker design. It's faster and easier to use and you'll find that it feels more natural. This new and improved operating system has launched features such as the Control Center and Button Shapes, but you'll also notice that old features, such as multitasking, have become smarter. You can make life easier by using the AirDrop to easily share photos with other iOS 7 users connected to Wi-Fi. The total integration of Facebook and Twitter into iOS 7 has made it easier than ever to post to Facebook or send a tweet. You can even consult your Twitter feed directly through the Bookmarks area of Safari. Safari also includes a search bar integrated into it's address bar so that you can quickly find information on the web. There have also been improvements made to help boost your privacy and security. Learn how to make the most of your iOS 7 device by following this course on the newest version of Apple's mobile operating system.

subject.title: Migrating from Office 2003 to 2010
subject.description: If you have recently migrated from Office 2003 to Office 2010, then this training course is for you. In it, you will learn how to get to grips with the new interface and how to convert your old documents into the new Office formats. In 2010, these new formats - DOCX, XLSX, and PPTX - allow you to use a range of new features, and are now applied by default to any new documents you create. The old DOC, XLS, and PPT formats used in Office 2003 are, however, still available if you need to create or save documents that are backwards compatible. The Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 2010 interface features a new ribbon command center: this course will show you how to use it to find all the tools you know already. You will also find out how to use a number of new tools, including the bibliography manager for your cited works, improved WordArt graphics, and document themes.

subject.title: Firefox 25
subject.description: This course will teach you how to use the features in the Mozilla Firefox web browser. You'll notice that Firefox has many of the features that other web browsers have. However, there are a few new features particular to this updated version. You'll be introduced to the New Tab page, themes and complete themes as well as the "switch to tab" option. You will also learn how to personalize your browser with add-ons and extensions. After mastering the basics, you'll learn about advanced features, such as the syncing of data between multiple devices and the management of memory allocations.

subject.title: Internet Explorer 11
subject.description: This in-depth course will help you master Internet Explorer 11, the latest version of the world's most popular web browser. It covers the basics as well as more complex configurations, allowing you to browse the internet in complete security. Internet Explorer 11 makes your web surfing session even faster thanks to the address bar, which doubles as a search bar. Moreover, your safety and privacy are reinforced by features which fight against user tracking.

subject.title: YouTube
subject.description: YouTube is a video-sharing website that is offered as part of Google Services. Use YouTube to browse through its always expanding video collection to watch videos posted to the site. You'll also be able to post your own videos to YouTube, once you've signed into your account. Edit your videos directly from YouTube using the integrated video enhancement tools and open-source audio library. If you're looking to maintain your own YouTube page, you can create a YouTube channel and start getting channel subscribers. This makes it easy to share videos about your brand, your company or your interests. See how to customize your channel and how to start monetizing on your channel.

subject.title: Pinterest
subject.description: Pinterest is a social media service that you can use to save web-based content called "pins" to virtual boards found on your profile. You can collect, organize, and share your pins with other "pinners" or contacts from your email and social media accounts. Once you've created an account you can update your profile, sync your social media accounts and share your interests. With the Pinterest app for iOS devices you can now save pins from the internet or directly from your mobile device. Pinterest's lens function is also a quick and easy way to search for pins you're interested in from billions of ideas shared on the site.

subject.title: Feedly
subject.description: RSS (Rich Site Summary) allows you to easily stay informed by retrieving the latest content from the sites you are interested in. An RSS document (called "feed") includes full or summarized text as well as the article's publishing date and author's name. Feedly is an application that compiles RSS feeds from a variety online sources, making it easy for your to monitor various sites and keep a close eye on certain news stories. Mark certain sources as must reads and then categorize them so that you can sift through them faster. You can even share important discoveries with contacts. The application is customizable, and you can configure the colors, buttons and information viewed to make it easier for you to use. Moreover, you can export your feeds and the categories you've created for them. Once you've exported the information into an OPML file, you can import the data back into Feedly or into another feed manager.

subject.title: Buffer
subject.description: Buffer is a web app that allows you to publish posts across your various social networks. First you'll see how to link your accounts to Buffer, including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, app.net et Google+. Then we'll take a look at how to share posts from these accounts within the Buffer site, either immediately or at a scheduled time. The advantage of Buffer is that you can schedule regular posts to ensure a continuous presence on your social networking sites. If you add a post to your Buffer Queue, the post is added to a waiting list and published at precisely the right time. You can also modify your content or publication time from within the Queue if you so desire. Buffer then offers extensive analyses for each of the posts that you publish from your Buffer account. We'll look at how to adjust your account settings to optimize the way you use the service.

subject.title: iTunes 11
subject.description: iTunes 11, Apple's free media player and media library application, allows you to listen to and manage your multimedia files. That includes music, films and podcasts. You can also transfer or sync your files with your iPhone, iPad or iPod Touch. It's recommended that you organize your digital files (either manually or with the aid of the iTunes Media folder) before adding them to your iTunes library. You can import files from a variety of sources including your computer, a USB key or a CD. You can also download and purchase music, movies and podcasts via the iTunes Store. With the aid of playlists that you create, you'll learn how easy it is to burn a CD of your favorite music. You can even manage the on data your Apple devices using iTunes 11.

subject.title: Basecamp 2
subject.description: This training course covers Basecamp 2, an online project management service that can be used to store all your project details in the cloud. Users can organize their team members, project tasks, deadlines and project assets from a single online location, accessed via their internet browser. Once a project has been created, the manager can invite team members to begin contributing. Users can create to-do lists to help them plan each stage of the project, and everyone can keep up to date on their project's development via the progress reports, personalized activity summaries, and email notifications. It is also possible to store and centralize a project's assets in Basecamp, which means that users will always have access to the files they need to complete their task. Users can upload standard office documents, PDFs, images, and even zipped folders. If the team uses Google Drive to create and store documents, these can also be integrated with Basecamp. It is even possible to create text documents online, using Basecamp's own note tool. For users often away from their computer, everything uploaded to Basecamp can be accessed on the go via the official iPhone app.

subject.title: Facebook 2013
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the Facebook social networking service. Find out how to create and customize your profile, how to create a network of friends, and how to begin interacting with other users. You will also learn how to use Facebook to share your photos, write articles, and even create and organize events. Facebook can also be used to manage the online presence and visibility of your company, association or project. This course was produced using the 2012/2013 interface. Facebook is currently deploying a new interface for 2014.

subject.title: PowerPoint for iPad
subject.description: This course covers all the features offered on PowerPoint for iPad. As part of the Microsoft Office Suite that was released for use on mobile devices, the application makes it easy to view and modify PowerPoint presentations when you're on the go. You can even access presentations you've saved in OneDrive, Microsoft SharePoint or DropBox.You can also create new Powerpoint presentations with the help of the application. This course will cover how to create presentations and how to add details such as images, charts and tables. You'll also learn how to apply themes so that you can create customized presentations. After learning how to work on saved and newly created presentations, you'll learn how to organize and share them.

subject.title: Salesforce Lightning 2016
subject.description: Salesforce Lightning is a CRM you can use to manage your sales and business need. Create leads and nurture them into opportunities to help reach your sales goals. You'll see how to get around this new Salesforce platform and become familiar with the layout. See how to create leads, accounts opportunities and more. You'll also see how to send emails, create tasks as well as events to help enrich your sales experience.

subject.title: Word for iPad
subject.description: Word for iPad allows you to access, create and modify your Word documents via your iPad while you're on the go. This course covers all of the basic features the application offers its users. Not only can you retrieve files saved on your device, but the Word for iPad app connects you to OneDrive, OneDrive for Business and Microsoft Office 365's SharePoint so that you can retrieve files from and save files to these locations.With Word for iPad, you can quickly edit the lay-out of a text document. This course will also cover how to work with the formatting so that you can customize the text alignment or modify line and paragraph spacing. You'll also learn how to add a splash of color to your document and integrate images. It will become clear how easy it is to collaborate on a project by using the comments feature and then sharing the document online or over email. Lastly, we'll cover how to save your document properly so you can be sure not to lose any changes you've made.

subject.title: Excel for iPad
subject.description: Excel for iPad allows you to access, create and modify your Excel documents via your iPad while you're on the go. This course covers all of the basic features the application offers its users. Not only can you retrieve files saved on your device, but the Word for iPad app connects you to OneDrive, OneDrive for Business and Microsoft Office 365's SharePoint so that you can retrieve files from and save files to these locations.Excel for iPad doesn't offer all the features the desktop version provides, but you will be able to quickly view and modify workbooks. You'll also be able to manage your data range by editing numerical data such as prices and percentages. Moreover, you'll be able to add and/or edit dates, hypertext links and contextual data.After opening a previously created workbook or creating a new one, you'll have the opportunity to sort and filter the data as well as create charts so that you can better present and analyze your information. This course will also cover how to do both simple and more complex calculations. Not only will we explore the use of absolute and relative cell references, but we will also explain how to create formulae using a combination of functions.

subject.title: Google Docs 2016
subject.description: This series of tutorials will take you through all the key tools in Google Document, the word-processing application offered as part of the Google Drive office suite. Based entirely online, Google Document allows you to create and format a text-based document in no time at all. As well as creating documents from scratch using the service, you can also import files that you have already created using another program - such as Open Office or Microsoft Word - and work on it in Google Document. These video tutorials will also show you how to insert images, including charts, photographs, and customized diagrams. You can even add interactivity to the document with the insertion of hyperlinks and bookmarks. And once you have finished your document, you can share it with your colleagues via email, publish it on the internet, or even invite others to participate in its creation with you using the share tools. The integrated comments system will help you to discuss your document and ensure that it really is the product of your combined efforts.

subject.title: Chatter
subject.description: Chatter is Salesforce's enterprise social network. It's built on the Salesforce platform, so employees have access to a variety of collaborative features. Users can share information in a flash through status updates or over instant messaging. You can even create surveys to poll your contacts and join secure branded groups to keep up to date on important issues. One of the  biggest advantages of Chatter is that it offers users a secure and social means of sharing documents, allowing different departments of a company to react quickly and take advantage of opportunities as soon as they become available.

subject.title: Google Chrome 37
subject.description: In this course you'll learn how to use Google Chrome and all its features. You'll learn all about the specific features in Chrome, such as syncing all your Google services through your browser. You'll be able to customize your browser using downloadable themes and extensions available from the Chrome Web Store, and youll learn more about how to protect your privacy and browse the Internet safely. We'll also look at how to use Chrome as an app if youre using Windows 8.

subject.title: Opera 24
subject.description: This course will show you how to surf the web with the Opera browser. Opera 24 is a faster, simplified version of the program. Well look at features like Speed Dial, Stash, and new tab options. You will learn how to personalize your browser with themes and extensions, as well as how to customize your settings.

subject.title: Google Drive 2014
subject.description: This course will introduce the services offered by Google Drive. The new interface allows the user to access the five applications offered by Google Drive. From the list view, the user can create text documents (Google Document), spreadsheets (Google Spreadsheet), visual presentations combining text and graphics (Google Presentation), forms (Google Forms), and diagrams and images (Google Drawing). It is also possible to access an extensive gallery of pre-formatted templates: users can even create and share their own customized templates. Using these tutorials, you will explore the different menus, sort your documents, and locate specific documents using the search function. The list view can also be used to modify the share settings for a particular document.

subject.title: Firefox 32
subject.description: In this course we'll surf the web with the Mozilla Firefox web browser. When you download and install Firefox, you'll see that it is similar to other web browsers. However, there are a few new features particular to this updated version, such as Tab Groups and security settings.You will also learn how to personalize your browser with add-ons for themes or new features. After mastering the basics, you can learn about advanced features, such as the syncing of data between multiple devices and managing browser cache.

subject.title: Skype 6.2.1
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the key features of Skype 6.2.1. First of all, well see how to install the application and create your own user account. In this version of Skype you can send files or start a video conference with multiple participants from all over the world. Skype 6.2.1 allows you to very quickly add people to your contacts list by username, email address, or simply the first and last name. You can communicate with these contacts via instant messages, voice chat and even video calls. You can still use Skype for call forwarding and voicemail, including video messages. Well also take a closer look at the Skype app for other devices, such as Windows 8, Android, and iOS.

subject.title: WebEx 2014
subject.description: In this training course, we'll cover the main features offered by the Webex meeting service. Once you have a Webex account, you can start, join, or schedule a conference call or a video conference. You can verify your devices and adjust your preferences. We'll look at how to invite participants, change someone's role, and share files. Webex has a number of communication tools, such as a chat window for instant messages and the possibility of dialing in from a regular phone. You can share your entire desktop, or you can share an application from your computer to better collaborate with meeting participants. You can also use Webex whiteboard to better brainstorm and exchange ideas: these whiteboards can be used to create professional documents, and you can download or share them easily. You can also record your meetings in an easy-to-read format for later review or upload files to your Webex account online.

subject.title: GoToMeeting
subject.description: In this training course, you will learn how to install and use the GoToMeeting software. You can start a meeting immediately or schedule it for an upcoming date. Well see how to invite your attendees or join a meeting that is already underway. Depending on your role, you can share your screen, as well as use audio and video communication tools. Well also look at how to change the roles of the attendees and record the meeting to review it later on or share it with others. With GoToWebinar, you can widen your audience and hold online seminars. You can then do polls and create surveys, as well as generate reports to analyze the future implications of your work or to improve your techniques for the next time.

subject.title: Prezi Classic
subject.description: With the Prezi website, you can create lively, interactive presentations free of charge. Together we'll see how to add steps to your presentation path, how to include images, sound, or video, and how to connect the different ideas in your presentation in a visual way. You can use Prezi to create transitions and animations within your presentation, and you can also import various files, including PowerPoint presentations.

subject.title: OneNote Online
subject.description: OneNote Online is a web app that offers a lot of the same tools available in the OneNote desktop application. You can use this web app to collaborate with colleagues or to simply keep track of your shopping lists. OneNote.com is particularly useful for sharing your work with others, including various file sharing options. In this course, you'll see how to make the best use of the web app, from creating notes with images or tables to publishing your work on your website or social network.

subject.title: Instagram
subject.description: Social media has grown a lot since the beginning and with that the emphasis has been put on sharing photos and videos. Instagram is an application that enables you take, edit and share your content with other users. You can add filters to make your photos or videos stand out. Follow other users and discover your inner photographer with Instagram.

subject.title: Evernote 5.8
subject.description: Evernote is an organizational application that allows you to take and save notes as text, image or audio. In this course we'll see how to take notes in all these formats, as well as how to insert images, tables and files into your notes. Since Evernote understands the importance of teamwork, they've made it easy to share your notes with your colleagues, friends and family. Learn how to share your notes via email, social networking, and Work Chat.

subject.title: Tumblr
subject.description: In this course you will learn how to navigate your way around Tumblr, posting text, quotes, photos, videos and more to your blog. Multimedia posts will allow you to enrich your blog's content and to make it more attractive to other Tumblr users. You will also learn how to follow other users and manage your subscriptions. Finally, you will see how to adjust the settings for your dashboard and notifications, as well as learning how to customize the layout of your blog using Tumblr themes.

subject.title: Google Forms
subject.description: This series of tutorials will take you through all of the key tools and options available in Google Forms. With this training course, you will find out how to create your very own online questionnaires and how to benefit from the form templates now available in Google Forms. These forms can contain a number of different types of questions, including multiple choice, scaled questions, drop-down lists, and paragraph-based, open questions. As well as being able to create simple questions, you can also insert complex structures, including variable sections that are accessed according to the user's responses. We'll also look at how to analyze the raw data submitted by your questionnaire's recipients.

subject.title: Google Keep
subject.description: Google Keep allows you to make and keep notes using your Google account. Learn how to create a new text, checklist, image or hand-drawn note, as well as to pin reminders to your notes and to share them with other users. You will also learn how to customize the appearance of your notes and the way they are displayed on the site. This course deals with both the version of Keep which can be accessed from your web browser and the app which is available for Android devices.

subject.title: FreeMind 1.0.1
subject.description: Mind maps (also known as spider diagrams or brainstorms) can help you to organise your ideas or plan projects or events, and allow you to view tasks, deadlines and project phases in a more synthetic and visual way. In this course you will see how to create and customize detailed mind maps and to get the most out of FreeMind.

subject.title: MindManager 2016
subject.description: MindManager allows you to create and manage projects, be they personal or professional. The software is based on using mind maps to organize your thoughts.  MindManager allows you to manage different tasks and resources in order to keep track of progress and timing. The program also allows you to organize brainstorming sessions and create analytical diagrams, such as a SWOT analysis. You will also see how to present your mind maps in a slide-show format.

subject.title: Photoshop Elements 13
subject.description: Photoshop Elements 13 is a multimedia software package with two distinct modes: Organizer and Editor. Organizer mode allows you to organize your photos into albums and to search them according to the location, date, event, keywords or even the people appearing in the photo. Editor mode has three options available for users with different levels of experience and technical competences. Its tools allow you to edit, retouch and adjust your photos, to add text and other elements, and to integrate your photos into more advanced images. Finally, it is possible to use Photoshop Elements 13 alongside social media and your e-mail account in order to share your photos and pictures with others.

subject.title: Google Chrome 43
subject.description: In this course you'll learn how to use Google Chrome and take advantage of its features. You'll learn how to sync Google services in your browser. You'll be able to customize your browser using downloadable themes and extensions available in the Chrome Web Store, and youll learn more about how to protect your privacy and browse the Internet safely. We'll also look at how to use Chrome as an app if youre using Windows 8.

subject.title: Premiere Elements  13
subject.description: Adobe Premiere Elements 13 is a video editing software program that allows you to import all different types of media files (videos, images, music, etc.) to help you create your movie. The interface has 3 different modes: Quick, Expert and Guided, which is a step-by-step guide for performing different actions in the program. You can edit your different imported media files and create your movie with numerous tools like adding transitions and end credits. There are also several effects available that you can use to add a certain style to your film like the Comic effect, for example. Once you have finished making your movie, you can export it in different formats (DVD, AVCHD, etc.) or share it on social media (Facebook, Vimeo or YouTube).

subject.title: Skype for Business 2015
subject.description: Skype for Business 2015 (previously known as Lync) is an Office app that offers a variety of real-time communication services including instant messaging, audio and video calls, online meetings and conference call presentation features. Skype for Business is available across devices, so you can access it from your desktop computer, smartphone, tablet and even from a landline phone or your TV if your network configuration allows it. This course will explain the basics, such as how to connect for the first time and how to add contacts, and it will also go over the more advanced uses of Skype for Business. It will cover how to use instant messaging, how to make audio and video calls, and how to communicate with multiple contacts. Youll see how to schedule Skype for Business conference calls from your calendar in Outlook 2013 or Outlook Web App and how to view your daily list of scheduled calls directly from Skype for Business. You will learn how to connect to scheduled conference calls as well as how to present and share documents with other meeting participants.

subject.title: Sway Web App
subject.description: Part of the Office 365 suite, Sway Web App is an online storytelling and presentation application that allows you to quickly and easily create and share rich, visual-oriented documents called "sways". You can insert text and multimedia elements from your computer, as well as from other websites and online sources. The layout and style of your sway can also be customized, and you can also share your it with your contacts and publish it in a variety of different ways.

subject.title: Box 2015
subject.description: Box is an online storage space that allows you to share your files from anywhere as long as you have an internet connection. You can, for example, create Excel spreadsheets and surveys, Word documents, and PowerPoint presentations. Once a document is available online, you can share it with other users, in or outside of your company. You can decide whether the users with whom you have shared the files can simply view them or enjoy full editing permissions. You can organize your documents into folders, and open them via the Office Online suite or a locally installed version of Office to create and edit documents. This makes it easy to synchronize your files across multiple devices like Android and iOS mobile devices. Finally, you can also collaborate using the comments tool to leave messages for others to see on shared documents and folders.

subject.title: Windows 10
subject.description: Windows 10 combines the familiarity of Windows 7 with the seamlessness of Windows 8 to offer a more a user-friendly operating system perfectly designed for PCs, tablets, smartphones and hybrid devices.
