With the addition of the tablet mode, interaction with your device is made simple and easy to navigate. In tablet mode you can perform the same actions and run the same programs as on the desktop version of Windows 10. Switch back and forth between the two modes as you'd like, no matter what type of device youre using. In Windows 10 the start menu is back  redesigned to make your files, apps and settings easily accessible. You can personalize the start menu to display your favorite news and weather updates and save applications as tile shortcuts. Next to the start menu on the desktop youll also find the addition of the Windows 10 search bar. Use the search bar to find anything youre looking for in one single place. Even your control panel settings can be found here. The search bar is integrated with the virtual assistant, Cortanabridging the gap between your PC and the web. Speak directly with Cortana using the command Hey Cortana followed by your question or request, to get help finding documents, managing your calendar and finding real-time information about anything from movie show-times, to the weather forecast. The more you interact with Cortana, the more tailored the responses will be. You can even use Cortana to get newsfeed updates on specific news topics or to translate phrases to and from several different languages.

subject.title: Edge
subject.description: With the release of Windows 10, Microsoft launched a new web browser, Edge. In this course, you will learn how to use this innovative new browser's features, both old and new. Edge is designed to interact with other Microsoft applications, such as Cortana, OneNote, and Outlook, in order to offer you new options for searching, sharing, and saving web pages, as well as allowing you to optimize your viewing and annotate pages using its in-built 'read view' and 'notes' modes.

subject.title: Windows Phone 8.1
subject.description: Windows Phone 8.1 is Microsoft's mobile operating system. Discover new features and become familiar with the Windows Phone user interface. See how to access your emails, contacts and multimedia files from your touchscreen device. Sync your Outlook or other email accounts and access all the familiar apps has to offer without having to enter you account information every time. You'll also be able to search online using the Cortana personal assistant for interactive, personalized search results. Customize your Windows Phone to better meet your needs.

subject.title: Google Chrome 46
subject.description: In this training course, you will learn to make use of Google's many features, as well as discovering the specific features of the Google Chrome browser. You will see how to create and customize your user account, personalize your browse,r and make sure your personal data is kept secure.

subject.title: PowerPoint 2016 for Windows
subject.description: PowerPoint 2016 is part of the Microsoft Office 2016 suite and allows users to create and organize their presentations and slide shows. It also features specialized presenter tools and modes to help deliver presentations. Users can insert text boxes, illustrations - such as images, tables and charts - and even multimedia files. PowerPoint 2016 also comes complete with a number of new preset and customizable themes as well as transitions and animations, all of which can be used to change the appearance of the entire presentation or individual slides. PowerPoint 2016 is also optimized for collaborative working: users can send their presentation to colleagues using the integrated email function, leave comments and add annotations to a slide, or store and share their file online using OneDrive.

subject.title: Firefox 41
subject.description: With this course you will see how to use the different functions of Firefox 41, the Mozilla browser for Windows 10. You will see how to find and use the different options, and search engines, as well as the advanced settings. Discover how to manage tab groups, customize your browser, and set security settings to ensure your privacy. You will also get to know Hello, Firefoxs new chat program found within the browser itself.

subject.title: IT Security for End Users
subject.description: Every employee in a corporate environment plays a role in ensuring IT systems and networks are secure from threats. This course covers the common security threats that corporate computers and mobile devices are vulnerable to, and the best practices that end users can utilize to help ensure the environment isn't compromised by these IT security threats.

subject.title: Word 2016 for Windows
subject.description: In this course, you will see all the functions and uses of Word 2016, the word processing program for Office 2016. You will learn how to create complex documents and how to format them and adjust their layout. You will see how to use paragraph styles, templates and document themes. Automatized tools will allow you to quickly and efficiently generate contents pages, indexes and bibliographies. Additionally, you will see how to create envelopes which can be filled in automatically with the details of contacts from your address book. Word 2016 also has a number of graphic tools and special effects which make it easy to create titles, tables and other graphic elements which really stand out. Finally, you will see how to use the most recent additions to Word 2016, using your OneDrive account to save your documents online so that you can access them from anywhere you have an internet connection, as well as working on them alongside collaborators with real-time updates. You will also see how to share documents using e-mail and work on a document with other users in real-time.

subject.title: Outlook 2016 for Windows
subject.description: Use Outlook 2016, the email client for Microsoft's Office 2016 suite, to read and reply to emails and manage multiple accounts. If you receive a lot of emails, then you can use Outlook to organize them into folders and subfolders and find them again with the helpful search tool. Access the calendar, contacts and tasks directly from your inbox. Check out new features such as Clutter. Also see how to customize, modify and adapt Outlook 2016 to meet your everyday needs.

subject.title: iOS 9 (iPad / iPhone)
subject.description: iOS 9 is an upgraded operating system from iOS 8 for Apple's iPad and iPhone. In this course you'll discover new features such as multitasking as well as new spotlight and settings search options. Discover, uncover and get familiar with all iOS 9 has to offer to improve your everyday usage easier. Connect to iCloud and share your files via AirDrop to save time and space on your devices.

subject.title: OneNote 2016 for Windows
subject.description: OneNote 2016, a note-taking tool and organizer, is part of the Office 2016 suite. This training course will show you how to create a new notebook, add a variety of different types of notes, links, and illustrations, and even annotate your pages using the drawing tools. You will also find out how to share your notebook, how to print it out, and even how to send certain pages via email.

subject.title: Excel 2016 for Windows
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Excel 2016, the spreadsheet application released as part of the updated Microsoft Office 2016 suite. Use Excel spreadsheets to organize a wide variety of different data types, including text, numbers, percentages, dates, monetary figures, and even hyperlinks. You can create tables, adjust their appearance, and easily filter and sort your data entries. Excel 2016 is especially useful for performing calculations with your data. Take advantage of a huge library of formulas and functions. These can be used to perform calculations with varying degrees of complexity. You can incorporate conditions, apply different methods of analysis, and even extract individual cell elements to be used elsewhere in your spreadsheet. Quickly analyze and summarize your data by presenting it in different ways. You can use a variety of different chart types to create graphical representations of your data values, and you can change the way in which your entries are analyzed using PivotTables. Excel 2016 also features a number of new tools, including Flash Fill, which can be used to automatically add data to your table. Excel 2016 also features a whole suite of collaboration tools for improved shared working practices. You can send your documents via email, protect them and convert them into different file formats, and even upload them to your cloud storage space. Shared access to these documents can also be activated, and access links can be created with ease. Direct communication other users is also optimized, with updated comments and change tracking tools in Excel 2016.

subject.title: Visio 2016
subject.description: Microsoft Visio 2016, part of the extended Office 2016 suite, allows you to create a wide range of different types of diagrams. The program comes complete with a large number of predefined stencils, as well as a number of very useful functions. You can create a pivot diagram, a company organization chart, a floor plan for a house or office, or even a map. Here you will see how to insert and organize the pages of your document, and how to integrate complex elements into your diagrams: text boxes, images, graphics and tables, which can be personalized using different inbuilt themes and colors.Visio 2016 also allows you to integrate data into your document, linking it with your diagrams in several useful ways. This software also has in-built functions that facilitate collaboration; you can quickly and easily share your diagrams by e-mail, share them online and add comments for your colleagues.

subject.title: Illustrator - CC 2015
subject.description: Adobe Illustrator sets the standard for design and illustration, and its used by graphic designers to create stunning original artwork. Illustrator is very flexible and you can create designs that range from simple illustrations to complex designs like logos and web banners, and even brochures, ads, and posters. Adobe Illustrator CC 2015 represents the next generation in this long-standing application, preserving the finesse and ease of its predecessors while adding some powerful new features. In this course, you will get an overview of Adobe Illustrator CC 2015 features and options.

subject.title: InDesign - CC 2015
subject.description: Adobe InDesign CC 2015 is a professional-grade desktop publishing application, used by graphics professionals and novices alike to create page layouts. Integrated with Adobe's other two flagship applications Photoshop and Illustrator InDesign can be used to create small documents like brochures and newsletters, or very large publications like books and manuals. In this course, you will be introduced to the tools, techniques, and options in Adobe InDesign CC 2015.

subject.title: Photoshop - CC 2015
subject.description: Adobe Photoshop sets the standard for image editing. Its used by photographers, graphic designers, professionals and novices alike, to create stunning original images or simply edit photographs. Adobe Photoshop CC 2015 represents the next generation in this long-standing application, preserving the finesse and ease of its predecessors while adding some powerful new features. This course covers the essentials, tools, navigation and advanced techniques in Adobe Photoshop CC 2015.

subject.title: Premiere Pro - CC 2015
subject.description: Adobe Premiere Pro CC 2015 is a professional-grade video editing application that can be used to create studio-quality videos. From very short clips like commercials to long videos like feature-length movies, Premiere Pro is up to the task. This course introduces learners to the tools, techniques, and video editing features in Adobe Premiere Pro CC 2015.

subject.title: Dreamweaver - CC 2015
subject.description: Adobe Dreamweaver CC 2015 is a web development application that can be used to develop single web pages or to create and manage entire websites. Dreamweaver CC supports HTML5 as well as all the popular formats for files, such as CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and XML. This course introduces you to the interface, features, and advanced techniques in Adobe Dreamweaver CC 2015.

subject.title: Android 6.0
subject.description: Android's 6.0 operating system is called Marshmallow. You can use this operating system on your tablet or smartphone. Discover new features and become familiar with the Android user interface. See how to access your emails, contacts and multimedia with your touchscreen device. Sync your Google account and access all the familiar apps Google has to offer without having to enter you account information every time. Personalize and customize your Android device to meet your needs.

subject.title: Google Chrome 48
subject.description: In this course, you will learn to make use of Google's many features and will discover the specific features of the Google Chrome browser. You will see how to create and edit your user account, how to customize your browser and how to protect your privacy and browse the internet safely.

subject.title: Project 2016
subject.description: Discover how to use and get around Project 2016, Microsoft's project management software application. Project 2016 is part of the extended Office 2016 suite. This application will help you plan, organize and complete professional or personal projects. Using the application, you can break your projects down into different tasks which can then be adjusted, managed, and tracked individually, allowing you to keep your project on course. See how to set deadlines, allocate multiple resources as well as manage the duration and progress of each of your tasks. Also see how to create useful reports as well as import tables from other Office 2016 programs.

subject.title: Facebook 2016
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the Facebook social networking service. Find out how to create and customize your profile, how to create a network of friends, and how to begin interacting with other users. You will also learn how to use Facebook to share your photos or to create and organize events. Facebook can also be used to manage the online presence and visibility of your company, association or project.

subject.title: Captivate - 9
subject.description: Adobe Captivate 9 is a tool for developing responsive interactive content. It can be used to develop courses from scratch as well as record on-screen software activities. In this learning path, you will learn how to create and preview responsive projects, use themes, add slides and responsive content, and add a quiz. You'll also learn how to enhance content with media such as animations, video, and audio. You'll learn how to add interactive elements such as action buttons and how to publish a project to multiple devices.

subject.title: Edge Animate  - CC
subject.description: Adobe Edge Animate CC allows end users, web designers, and developers to create interactive animations for different purposes. This learning path covers the end-user experience from creation of a composition to publishing content to reach both desktop and mobile browsers.

subject.title: IBM Notes 9.0
subject.description: IBM Notes 9.0 is an email client, formerly known as Lotus Notes, that can be used to manage your professional or personal emails. See how to access, send, and manage you emails with ease. You will also find out how to add and organize your contacts, how to add new entries for your calendar, and how to create to do tasks. These tutorials will give you the tools needed to familiarize yourself with IBM Note 9.0.

subject.title: Cisco Jabber 11.1
subject.description: Cisco Jabber is an online and telephone communication tool. You will see how use Jabber's various tools, from simple instant messaging to video conferences and online meetings. You will see how to take part in virtual meetings, to share documents and to use different collaboration tools.

subject.title: Access 2016
subject.description: This training course covers the full range of features available using Access 2016, which comes as part of the Office 2016 suite. Access is a database management program which allows you to store data in various linked tables, each containing multiple records. In this training course, you will see how to create and fill your tables and to create and customize data entry forms. You will also see how to create queries, which will allow you to group linked sets of data from different tables. These queries allow you to carry out calculations and automatically fill in columns of data. Finally, you will learn to generate reports, complete documents created on the basis of the contents of your database.

subject.title: Linkedin 2016
subject.description: Linkedin is a social network that allows you to expand your professional network. With its powerful search feature you can easily find connections by sending them invitations to join your network. Browse job offers or search different for potential job applicants. This network also allows to show your professional profile and the profile of your business. You can connect with groups to discuss idea or likeminded views. Discover how to get around and get the most out of Linkedin.

subject.title: Sway for Windows 10
subject.description: Sway for Windows 10 is an Office application that allows you to quickly and easily create and share presentations. You can insert text and media elements from your computer, as well as from other websites (OneDrive, Twitter, and Google Maps, for example). The layout and style of your presentation can also be customized, and you will be able to share your presentation with your contacts, as well as making them available via social media, Docs.com, or your own website or blog.

subject.title: Google Photos
subject.description: Google Photos is a useful service for storing and organizing photos. In this course, you will see how to upload and back up your photos from your web browser and Android and iOS devices. You will see how to organize, sort, retouch and reframe your photos. You will also see how to create a movie, animation and collage with your photos and/or videos.

subject.title: Chatter Lightning
subject.description: Chatter Lightning is an internal social media network integrated within Salesforce Lightning, the newest CRM from Salesforce. You can connect and communicate with you team through feed updates as well as the collaboration function found within the Salesforce objects. Share updates, files and even conduct polls to get you colleagues opinions on a question you may have. See how to get around and use this new version of Chatter found on Salesforce Lightning.

subject.title: Evernote 6.0
subject.description: Evernote is a program designed for note taking, organizing and archiving. Notes can be created as formatted text, images and audio. In this course you will see how to create and format your notes. You will also see how to create notes using images, tables and how to attach files. Evernote also allows you to share your notes in several ways including via email, social networks and its integrated chat function, Work Chat.

subject.title: Twitter 2018
subject.description: Twitter is a social networking and microblogging service that can be used to send short messages - known as tweets - to other users on the platform. Recent updates have seen the character number increased to 280 characters, meaning that users can fit more information into each tweet. Twitter can also be used to follow updates and news stories posted by journalists, politicians, film stars, athletes, and musicians. As well as tweets, users can also post videos, images, and polls on the Twitter platform. The more you use Twitter, the more your feed will become filled with messages: it is therefore extremely important to know how to organize and filter your tweets, and find the information you are looking for. Twitter also features a powerful search engine, a list function, the Moments tool for highlighting particular tweets, and an option to include your location in your own messages.

subject.title: Slack
subject.description: Slack is a platform for team collaboration and communication. All the elements are on the cloud and easily accessible via an internet connection. To communicate with your contacts and organize your projects, you can use communication channels or direct messages. You will see how to use channels to participate in conversations with other team members. It's also possible to communicate privately with direct messages or private channels, share documents, and even integrate other external services such as Google Drive and Twitter. Slack is also available for mobile device such as iOS. See how to use and navigate the desktop as well as the mobile app in this course.

subject.title: Google Drive 2018
subject.description: From Google Drive you will be able to access all the tools offered by Google to stay on top of your files. The interface connects the various Google applications and file storage space. You can create and edit text documents as well as spreadsheets, presentations, forms, and photos. You will see how to best use Google Drive to store and organize your documents as well as follow and find them quickly. Also Drive allows you to assign file permissions and modification of the documents you share.

subject.title: Google Slides 2016
subject.description: This training course covers all the features found in Google Slides. This application from the Google Docs suite enables you to create slideshow presentations that can be used to support your oral presentations. With Google Slides you can create presentations for work, school and personal endeavours. The multiple tools at your disposal allow you to add multimedia elements to your slides such as images, animations and videos. You can also create charts, graphs and tables. With Google Slides you can customize your presentation from start to finish to meet your needs.

subject.title: Skype 7.23
subject.description: This series of tutorials will introduce you to the key features of Skype 7.23. First of all, well see how to install the application and create your own user account. In this version of Skype you can send files or start a video conference with multiple participants from all over the world. Skype 7.23 allows you to very quickly add people to your contacts list by username, email address, or simply the first and last name. You can communicate with these contacts via instant messages, voice chat and even video calls. You can still use Skype for call forwarding and voicemail, including video messages. Well also take a closer look at the Skype web app and the iOS versdion.

subject.title: IBM Connections
subject.description: IBM Connections is an internal corporate social network that offers all employees the opportunity to share information within the company network. You can receive and send information using publishing features as well as create a file and work on it in real time with your team> See how to create an exchange information with communities. Communities are newsgroups that you can join or create, and you will also see how to search and quickly find the information related to the activity of your network on IBM Connections.

subject.title: IBM Verse
subject.description: IBM Verse is an integrated email client that can be easily accessed from IBM Connections or IBM Notes. You can read, reply and compose emails from a user friendly interface. See how to access and use tools such as the search bar, contacts page and calendar. Create mailing lists and contact groups to easily manage your contacts when sending emails to multiple recipients. You'll also see how to use the instant messaging chat tool found directly from your IBM Verse interface. Creating events, meetings and collaborating with others is also possible within the integrated calendar function. See how to find and use the most important functions found within IBM Verse.

subject.title: Google Hangouts
subject.description: Google Hangouts is an instant messaging and video conferencing application. In this course, you will see how to handle the functionality of this service by discovering how the interface is organized on various platforms and devices. Hangouts allows you to communicate with your contacts in written, oral, and video conferencing. Google Hangouts also incorporates many features such as screen sharing, interaction applications, and collaborative tools. With Hangouts on Air, you can even broadcast your own programs, and interact with your audience.

subject.title: Facebook for iPad
subject.description: Facebook is a social networking service that allows you to keep in touch with your friends. The iOS application allows you to manage and share information with your friends. You will see how to create and configure your Facebook profile, share photos and manage your groups and pages in the iOS Facebook application.

subject.title: Twitter iOS
subject.description: See how to use all the features of the microblogging site Twitter on iOS.Once you've downloaded the application, you will see how to access and how to get the most out of Twitter.Users posts are very short messages, Tweets, which are immediately made public.You will have new friends and can follow live news published by journalists, politicians, celebrities, musicians and more.You can also post photos and videos directly in your tweet with your iOS device. Your feed is constantly updating so it's important to know the sort, and organize the tweets that interest you the most. Twitter has many tools such as a search engine, lists, and you can even add your location to your tweets. Twitter also a new feature which enables you to showcase what is currently happening or most popular on Twitter called 'Moments'.

subject.title: Facebook Messenger
subject.description: Facebook Messenger is a standalone instant messaging application offered by Facebook. You can connect to Messenger using your Facebook login in order to talk with friends, co-workers or even different businesses. This course will show you how to use this app on the iPad as well as  the web browser version. You will see how to sign in, send messages, make voice/video calls and manage your contacts.

subject.title: Outlook Web App (OWA) for iPad
subject.description: The Outlook Web App (OWA) for iPad is an application for iOS devices that allows you to access your emails received in the Outlook Web App. To use this application, you need to have an Office 365 account. In this course, you will see how to read, mark, organize and write email messages. You can also manage your contacts and schedule meetings/events in the application.

subject.title: Google Sheets 2016
subject.description: These tutorials will introduce you to Google Spreadsheet and its numerous toolsets and operations. You will find out how to enter and modify your data, as well as how to classify, sort, and filter your entries once you have inserted them into your worksheet. Your spreadsheet also functions as an extremely powerful calculator, allowing you to perform complex mathematical equations and analytical operations relating to your data. Google Spreadsheet also features a number of different tools that can help you to manipulate, reorganize, and present your data, including pivot table reports, graphical charts and heat maps. Google Spreadsheet being a highly collaborative application, these tutorials will also show you how to share your documents online with your work collaborators, and how to work with others on a single document at the same time.

subject.title: Windows 10 Mobile
subject.description: Windows 10 Mobile is Microsoft's mobile operating system. You will discover new features and become familiar with the mobile user interface. You will see how to access your emails, contacts and multimedia files from your touchscreen device. You will also learn how to sync your Outlook or other email accounts and perform a search online using the Cortana personal assistant for interactive, personalized search results. You will also see the several different ways to customize your Windows Mobile device to better meet your needs.

subject.title: Trello
subject.description: Trello is a web-based project management application. Projects are represented by boards, which are made up of task lists, which contain cards. In this course, you will see how to organize and collaborate on projects with your team. You will learn how to create boards, invite people to join your team, organize your lists and add photos, attachments, videos and even stickers to your boards. You will also see how to use other features like the calendar and Email-to-Board tools.

subject.title: Pocket
subject.description: Pocket is a free web application used to save, sort and read articles, pictures as well as videos that you have found on the web. It's very useful if you want to centralize multiple elements you want to read or watch later. In this training course, you'll see how to login to your account, save articles or videos, use the built-in reader to read articles and even how to recommend and share items that you like.

subject.title: Inbox by Gmail
subject.description: Inbox by Gmail is a webmail application developed by Google, which simplifies receiving and managing your emails. It is designed to prioritize and automatically store emails you receive. Inbox by Gmail is available if you have a standard Google account or a Google business account.

subject.title: OneNote for iPad
subject.description: OneNote for iPad is an application for note-taking and organizing. This course will show you how to create a new notebook, add a variety of different types of notes, links, and illustrations, and even annotate your pages using the drawing tools. You will see how to share your notebook via email and on social networks. You will also see how to use the scanning feature for documents and whiteboards and how to add a note directly from your browser to OneNote.

subject.title: Google Spaces
subject.description: Google Spaces is an application for group discussions and messaging. Users can share various types of content including images, videos and text. Each conversation, called a "Space," is centered around a specific topic of discussion that the owner creates. Google products like Google Search, Chrome and YouTube are built into the app so that users can view and share articles, photos and videos without having to leave the app. Any links that are shared are embedded directly in the conversation thread. You will see how to share links, images, photos and text in Spaces as well as how to manage your shared content. You will also see how to use Google Spaces on the desktop version as well as on the Android and iOS app versions.

subject.title: Convo
subject.description: Convo is a platform for team collaboration and communication. All the elements are on the cloud and easily accessible via an internet connection. To communicate with your contacts and organize your projects, you can use communication groups or chatmessages. You will see how to use groups to participate in conversations with other team members. It's also possible to communicate privately via the chat tool or private groups, share documents, and even integrate other external services such as Google Drive and Twitter. Convo is also available for mobile device such as iOS. See how to use and navigate the desktop as well as the mobile app in this course.

subject.title: Office 365 Planner
subject.description: Planner is an Office 365 application, which allows you to manage several projects simultaneously alongside other users Office 365 users. Planner allows you to create a plan, add the various tasks which need to be completed, and organize them into buckets. You can also add due dates and assign tasks to particular users within your group.

subject.title: Delve
subject.description: Delve is an application offered through the Microsoft Office 365 suite that helps users find the most relevant content across the other integrated Microsoft applications like Word, Excel and Powerpoint Online. Each user has a profile which includes recent documents and access to colleague profiles. Each user also has a Home page, which suggests Popular documents depending on their activity, the last date a document was modified and the interaction with their contacts. You will see how to organize your documents in Delve by creating boards with your documents and your colleagues documents. You will also see how to share documents with people within your organization and how to interact with the people you have connected with on Delve.

subject.title: SharePoint 2016
subject.description: SharePoint is a browser-based platform designed to encourage and support collaboration between company coworkers. It is available entirely online or integrated into your company's intranet, and can be used in conjunction with Office 365. Regardless of the delivery method, SharePoint comes with a number of key features, including a newsfeed, the OneDrive for Business file storage space, and Sites. This training course will introduce you to all these different features and show you how to navigate between the different components once you have signed in to the service. The newsfeed is SharePoint's social hub, which can be used to track user activity on the network and stay up to date on the latest changes to documents and sites. Individuals can create their own user profile and share news and announcements via the conversation tools. SharePoint also includes the Sites component, which allows users to create internal sites for centralizing work on a particular project or in a specific department. These sites can be customized in a number of different ways, including through the addition of apps, libraries and lists, and the modification of the site's theme, color scheme and font style. To do lists can be created, tasks managed and completed, and projects tracked. File storage can be done via document or image libraries, and certain file types - such as text documents, spreadsheets and presentations - can be edited online using the Office Web Apps suite. Individuals can also use OneNote to create their own online notebooks associated with particular sites or accounts. If users have been granted administrator privileges, they can edit, customize and manage the SharePoint platform itself. Discover how to use and get familiar with what SharePoint has to offer.

subject.title: Scoop.it
subject.description: Scoop.it is a web content curation tool that allows you to create curated content based on the topics that you choose. You can curate content directly from the internet or you can use the content Scoop.it suggests to you using the keywords you defined for a particular topic. Adding content to your topic boards is called "scooping" and the particular content itself is called a "scoop." You will see how to develop your online presence and grow your audience by browsing and interacting with the Scoop.it community, creating and editing topics and sharing your content on other social media channels like Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

subject.title: PowerPoint 2016 for Mac
subject.description: PowerPoint 2016 for Mac is part of the Microsoft Office 2016 suite and allows users to create and organize their presentations and slide shows. It also features specialized presenter tools and modes to help deliver presentations. Users can insert text boxes, illustrations - such as images, tables and charts - and even multimedia files. PowerPoint 2016 also comes complete with a number of new preset and customizable themes as well as transitions and animations, all of which can be used to change the appearance of the entire presentation or individual slides. PowerPoint 2016 is also optimized for collaborative working: users can send their presentation to colleagues using the integrated email function, leave comments and add annotations to a slide, or store and share their file online using OneDrive.

subject.title: SharePoint for iOS
subject.description: The SharePoint mobile app for iOS enables you to access you SharePoint team sites, groups and contacts. Manage you projects on the go by viewing documents and staying in touch with your colleagues. You can also post and manage your SharePoint blog page via the iOS application. See how to access and familiarize yourself with all that the SharePoint mobile app for iOS has to offer.

subject.title: Adobe Connect Meetings
subject.description: In this training course, you will learn how to install and use the Adobe Connect software. You can start a meeting immediately or schedule it for an upcoming date. Well see how to invite your attendees or join a meeting that is already underway. Depending on your role, you can share your screen, as well as use audio and video communication tools. Well also look at how to change the roles of the attendees and record the meeting to review it later on or share it with others.

subject.title: Outlook 2016 for Mac
subject.description: Use Outlook 2016 for Mac, the email client for Microsoft's Office 2016 for Mac suite, to read and reply to emails and manage multiple accounts. If you receive a lot of emails, then you can use Outlook to organize them into folders and subfolders and find them again with the helpful search tool. Access the calendar, contacts and tasks directly from your inbox. Check out new features such as Clutter. Also see how to customize, modify and adapt Outlook 2016 for Mac to meet your everyday needs.

subject.title: IBM Sametime 9 Connect
subject.description: IBM Sametime Connect is an application that allows you to quickly communicate with your employees and colleagues. With availability indicators you identify who is logged on and start interacting with someone via the chat tool. From you chat window you can share documents or even create online meetings.To get the most out of your meetings, see how to use the library to share files as well as share your screen or do a survey. You can also share an application and give it control to one of your collaborators.

subject.title: Word 2016 for Mac
subject.description: In this course, you will see all the functions and uses of Word 2016, the word processing program for Office 2016. You will learn how to create complex documents and how to format them and adjust their layout. You will see how to use paragraph styles, templates and document themes. Automatized tools will allow you to quickly and efficiently generate contents pages, indexes and bibliographies. Additionally, you will see how to create envelopes which can be filled in automatically with the details of contacts from your address book. Word 2016 also has a number of graphic tools and special effects which make it easy to create titles, tables and other graphic elements which really stand out. Finally, you will see how to use the most recent additions to Word 2016, using your OneDrive account to save your documents online so that you can access them from anywhere you have an internet connection, as well as working on them alongside collaborators with real-time updates. You will also see how to share documents using e-mail and work on a document with other users in real-time.

subject.title: iOS 10
subject.description: iOS 10 is an update to Apple's mobile operating system, available for iPad and iPhone. In this course you'll discover new features such as multitasking as well as new messaging and note sharing options. Discover, uncover, and get familiar with all iOS 10 has to offer to improve your everyday usage easier. Connect to iCloud and share your files via AirDrop to save time and space on your devices.

subject.title: IBM Sametime 9 Web Chat
subject.description: Web Chat is the online version of the IBM Sametime 9 application. Like Connect, it allows you to communicate quickly with your employees and colleagues. Once you've logged in from a browser, locate who is logged on and start interacting with someone via the chat tool. This will allow you to share documents or even create online meetings.To get the most out of these meetings, see how to use the library to share files as well as share your screen or do a survey. You can also share an application and give control to one of your collaborators.With this web version of Sametime, you will see how to make voice or video calls, privately and within a conference. You can moderate the meeting by adding or removing people as well as save and create an automatic report.

subject.title: Google Drawings 2016
subject.description: Google Drawings is a web-based diagramming software developed by Google. It is accessible from Google Drive and all files created in the application are automatically saved to Google Drive. In this course, you will learn how to create and manipulate various shapes and lines, how to customize these shapes using the color, effect and style settings, and how to use your diagrams in other documents. You will also see how to import images from your hard-drive and edit them using Google Drawings.

subject.title: Android 7.0
subject.description: Android 7.0 is called Nougat, which is an operating system you can use on your tablet or smartphone. In this course, you will discover new features and become familiar with the Android user interface. You will also see how to access your emails, contacts and multimedia with your touchscreen device. You'll learn how to sync your Google account and access all the apps Google has to offer without having to enter your account information every time. You'll also see how to customize your Android device to meet your needs.

subject.title: Excel 2016 for Mac
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Excel 2016 for Mac, the spreadsheet application released as part of the updated Microsoft Office 2016 for Mac suite. Use Excel spreadsheets to organize a wide variety of different data types, including text, numbers, percentages, dates, monetary figures, and even hyperlinks. You can create tables, adjust their appearance, and easily filter and sort your data entries. Excel 2016 for Mac is especially useful for performing calculations with your data. Take advantage of a huge library of formulas and functions. These can be used to perform calculations with varying degrees of complexity. You can incorporate conditions, apply different methods of analysis, and even extract individual cell elements to be used elsewhere in your spreadsheet.

subject.title: OneNote 2016 for Mac
subject.description: OneNote 2016 for Mac, a note-taking tool and organizer, is part of the Office 2016 suite. This course will show you how to create a new notebook, add a variety of different types of notes, links, and illustrations, and even annotate your pages using the drawing tools. You will also see how to share your notebook, print it out, and even how to send certain pages via email.

subject.title: Safari 10
subject.description: Safari 10 is the latest version of the browser developed by Apple. Thanks to its innovative functions, browsing the web has never been easier. Its Smart search field has made searching the internet even more efficient. Just like the new interface and intuitive tab display is totally enhanced by the use of the Multi-Touch gestures. You still have the possibility to post web pages in Facebook and Twitter or share them with Mail and Messages. Functions such as iCloud and the reading list allow you to access the pages and articles that interest you even more quickly. This training will help you discover the new and improved version of Safari.

subject.title: macOS Sierra
subject.description: macOS Sierra is the new version of the operating system of Apple (formerly known as OS X). The name has changed, but all the features you know are still available. There are also many new features such as Siri integration, Continuity technology, and multi-tasking capabilities. In this course you will see how to familiarize yourself with the environment as well as understand the features and manipulations offered by macOS Sierra.

subject.title: Firefox 50
subject.description: In this course you will learn how to use the different functions and features of Mozilla Firefox 54 in Windows 10. First, you will learn how to open and navigate the browser. You will see many functions you may already use in other browsers and the particular functions in Firefox, such as the quick search function, using thumbnails, installing add-ons or using the reader view. Finally, you'll see how to customize your browser with different extensions and themes.

subject.title: Microsoft Teams
subject.description: Microsoft Teams is a platform that combines workplace chat, meetings, notes, and attachments. It is fully-integrated with the Office 365 suite and is available online.In this course, you will see how to create different teams for different topics and create different chat spaces, or channels, where you can converse with your team members, share files and take notes. You will also see how to make audio and video calls as well as schedule meetings and participate in a video conference with multiple people. In Microsoft Teams you will also see how to add connectors like a Twitter or RSS feed to your specific channels so that all team member can stay up to date on certain topics or projects.

subject.title: Skype for Business 2016
subject.description: Skype for Business 2016 is the latest version of Microsoft's enterprise video conferencing and messaging client. With Skype for Business 2016, you can use instant messaging, voice, and video calling to converse with individual contacts and groups, and organize meetings ahead of time or on the fly. Skype for Business also features powerful collaboration and sharing tools to enrich your meetings and make them more dynamic. Create simple surveys to ask your meeting participants a question, share your desktop screen or application, and work on shared notebooks, documents, and presentations directly within the client. Skype for Business is also available in mobile app form, for iOS, Android, and Windows 10 Mobile.

subject.title: Office 365 Groups
subject.description: Office 365 Groups is a service that allows you to access a number of collaborative tools to help make working together easier. You can access all of the groups that you have created or are a part of directly from Outlook, including groups from applications like Planner, Microsoft Teams and SharePoint. After seeing how to access and navigate your groups, you will see how to manage group members, how to access and use your calendar and how to use the group notebook. You will also see in this course how to communicate with your group via the group conversation thread, how to mention members or other groups and how to share files from different sources. When you share or upload files, they are stored in the Files tab of the group as well as on SharePoint, which you will see how to manage as well.

subject.title: LinkedIn 2017
subject.description: LinkedIn is a social network that allows you to expand your professional network. With its powerful search feature you can easily find connections by sending them invitations to join your network. You can also browse job offers or search for potential job applicants. This network also allows you to show your professional profile and your company's page. You can connect with groups to discuss ideas or like-minded views or chat with your connections via the instant messaging feature. You will discover how to get around and get the most out of LinkedIn.

subject.title: GigJam
subject.description: GigJam is a productivity and collaboration tool available as part of the Office 365 subscription plan. It can be used to create and manage miniature, time-sensitive projects, called "gigs", which can then be used to work on documents and data with other users. Rather than sharing entire documents with other users, however, you can break individual files into its composite parts, which can then be shared with colleagues. You can bring in documents from all over your Office 365 environment, including OneDrive, Outlook, and SharePoint, and from even further afield, including Google search results, Trello projects, and even Salesforce databases. GigJam is also available as an iOS app.

subject.title: Workplace
subject.description: Workplace is a collaborative platform created by Facebook for professionals. You will find that many features offered on Facebook are also offered on Workplace like the News Feed, Timeline and chat options. In this course, you will see how to navigate the different parts of the interface and connect with your coworkers. You will see how to publish posts on your timeline, in groups as well as how to share multimedia elements like photos and videos. Once you connect with your coworkers, you can publish on their timeline as well as comment and reply on their posts, as well as on your own. You can even record live videos that your followers can then stream and react to.You can also create different groups and choose a specific group type to help group members know what topics to address on the group page. Groups are a great way to keep track of projects and stay up to date with your team. Finally, if you are an administrator of your company's Workplace account, you can add people to your network and access the Company Dashboard to setup your company site and access several other configurations to customize your company account to suit your needs.

subject.title: Basecamp 3
subject.description: This course covers Basecamp 3, an online project management service that can be used to store all your project details online. Users can organize their teams, projects, deadlines and tasks from a single online location, accessed via their internet browser. Once a team or project has been created, the manager can invite team members to begin contributing. Users can create to-do lists to help them plan each stage of the project, and everyone can keep up to date on their project's development via the reports function, personalized activity summaries, and email notifications. It is also possible to store and centralize a project's assets in Basecamp, which means that users will always have access to the files they need to complete their task. Users can upload standard office documents, PDFs, and images. If the team uses Google Drive to create and store documents, these can also be integrated with Basecamp. It is even possible to create text documents online, using Basecamp's own note tool. See how to create events and sync them directly with Google, iCal or Outlook. For users often away from their computer, everything uploaded to Basecamp can be accessed on the go via the official iOS app.

subject.title: Box 2017
subject.description: Box is an online storage space that allows you to share your files from anywhere as long as you have an internet connection. Once a document is available online, you can share it with other users, in or outside of your company. You can decide whether the users with whom you have shared the files can simply view them or enjoy full editing permissions. You can organize your documents into folders and open them via the Office Online suite or a locally installed version of Office to create and edit documents. You can also create Box Notes to take notes directly in the Box platform and share with your colleagues. You will also see how to use Box Sync, which is a desktop application that allows you to sync all your Box files to your computer in order to access them offline. Finally, you can also collaborate using the comments tool to leave messages for others to see on shared documents and folders.

subject.title: Microsoft Stream
subject.description: Microsoft Stream is an online application that is part of the Office 365 suite and is currently available in "Preview" mode. Stream allows you to upload and share videos with people in your organization or company. Once you have uploaded videos to Stream, you can categorize and organize them into channels. You can also embed a Microsoft Stream video in a website or blog and download the original video to your device. You will also see how to use the search and filter options to find videos and channels as well as how to leave comments and upload subtitles or captions for your videos.

subject.title: Photos for macOS Sierra
subject.description: Photos for macOS Sierra allows you to keep track and organize your photos in one location. This application enables you to sync and import images from outside sources or connect with your iCloud account. Create and share albums with others via the iCloud photo sharing function. This application also gives you the possibility to edit and modify your photos easily. See how to add filters as well as crop your photos. If you want to create a lasting memory for your photos you can create books, cards and calendars directly from the application.

subject.title: QuickBooks Pro - 2017
subject.description: QuickBooks Pro 2017 is a robust accounting software platform that can be used to record, track, and manage an organization's financial transactions. This learning path provides a comprehensive introduction to the QuickBooks software, from basic navigation and usage to banking, tax collection and remittance, payroll, and report generation.

subject.title: Mail for macOS Sierra
subject.description: This course covers all the features of Mail on macOS Sierra. Your new messages can be found in your inbox and viewed in your reading pane or in a separate window. A completely customizable favorites bar will allow you to save and find your emails in an instant. Mail is fully synchronized with other Sierra macOS applications. You can import and export images from the Photos application as well as create events for your Calendar application directly from your inbox. The archive function allows you to save all old emails that you may need in the future without encumbering your inbox. Time Machine allows you to restore your inboxes if your data is lost or accidentally deleted. You can also use Siri to create emails and perform operations with voice commands.

subject.title: Gmail 2018
subject.description: Gmail is an online messaging platform offered by Google. You can receive and send emails to your contacts with ease. In order to better manage your inbox you can add labels as well as mark your emails to help them stand out and make them easier to locate for future reference. Gmail is also equipped to automatically sort and filter out spam emails as well as mark emails that you deem important from specific senders. See how to organize your daily tasks according to deadlines. Google Calendar enables you to plan your events and organize meetings by sending invitations.

subject.title: Contacts for macOS Sierra
subject.description: This course will cover the functions and tools available within the Contacts application for macOS Sierra. If you've used previous versions of the app, you'll notice that the appearance has changed. This new interface gives you access to many features, which work with other applications on Mac such as Mail or iCal. For example, you can sync birthdays in your calendars as well as share items and updates via email. Contacts also gives you the possibility to create smart folders to organize your contacts automatically. See how to organize and manage multiple contact lists from different applications in this course.

subject.title: Excel for iPhone
subject.description: Excel for iPhone allows you to access, create and modify your Excel documents via your iPhone while you're on the go. This course covers all of the basic features the application offers its users. Excel for iPhone doesn't offer all the features the desktop version provides, but you will be able to quickly view and modify workbooks. You'll also be able to manage your data range by editing numerical data such as prices and percentages. Moreover, you'll be able to add and/or edit dates, hypertext links and contextual data.After opening a previously created workbook or creating a new one, you'll have the opportunity to sort and filter the data as well as create charts so that you can better present and analyze your information. This course will also cover how to do both simple calculations.

subject.title: Google Team Drives
subject.description: Google Team Drives is an online storage space that users can access using their professional Google email account and via their Google Drive storage space. Users will find that the interface for Teams is very similar to their personal Google Drive. Contrary to "My Drive," Team Drives is specifically designed to use between team members belonging to the same organization and is a collaborative tool. In this course, you will see how to create new Team Drives, upload files and create folders in your Team Drives. You will also learn how to manage access permissions for your team members as well as for individual documents. Finally, you will see how to configure your Google Drive settings and language preferences in order to configure the application to suit your needs.

subject.title: Dropbox 2017
subject.description: Dropbox is an online storage application that allows you to save and access your files on any device with an internet connection. You can then sync files from different computers and different devices such as iPad, iPhone and Smartphone Android. Synced files can be edited from your computer or the Dropbox desktop app and any changes your make will automatically appear in your online account. Dropbox also allows you to share files by email or creating a shared link which you can send to other members of your team or even to people without a Dropbox account.

subject.title: Publisher 2016
subject.description: Publisher 2016 is a Microsoft Office program in which you can create, customize and share publications. You can insert images into your publications from your computer or the internet which you can then modify and use to illustrate your documents or use as a background by adding to your publications master page view. The building block library allows you to insert different objects quickly and easily, such as calendars, borders or your business information. You also have the possibility of creating catalogs for your products or services and merging it to print. Publisher 2016 provides multiple ways for you to share your documents or prepare them for printing from a photo center or commercial printer.

subject.title: Join.me
subject.description: Join.me is a cloud-based application that allows coworkers, teams and businesses to create online meetings in just one click. You can use Join.me either in your browser or via the application. You can use screen sharing, audio and video to discuss with meeting participants. In this course, you will see how to start and join meetings instantly as well as plan a meeting in your calendar. You will see how to invite people to join your meetings and how to share your screen and use the different tools available. In Join.me you can also enable or disable audio or video, approve or deny people's requests to join your meetings, and can even record your meetings.Finally, you will see how to manage your account and security settings as well as how to generate reports and view your activity log.

subject.title: Word for iPhone
subject.description: Word for iPhone allows you to access, create and modify your Word documents on your iPhone while you're on the go. This course covers all of the basic features the application offers its users. Not only can you retrieve files saved on your device, but the Word for iPhone app connects you to OneDrive, OneDrive for Business and Microsoft Office 365's SharePoint so that you can retrieve files from and save files to these locations.With Word for iPhone, you can quickly edit the lay-out of a text document. This course will also cover how to work with the formatting so that you can customize the text alignment or modify line and paragraph spacing. You'll also learn how to add a splash of color to your document and integrate images. It will become clear how easy it is to collaborate on a project by using the comments feature and then sharing the document online or over email. Lastly, we'll cover how to save your document properly so you can be sure not to lose any changes you've made.

subject.title: Hangouts Meet
subject.description: Hangouts Meet, also called Google Meet, is a communication platform developed by Google. In this course, you will see how to use the different features of the application via the web app and on iOS.Once you see how to get around the application's interface, you will see how to start new meetings in just one click and schedule meetings for a later time. You will also see how to invite others to join your meetings and how to join a meeting as a guest. Finally, you will see how to enable or disable your audio and video and share your screen with the other meeting participants.

subject.title: Google Sites
subject.description: Google Sites is a website creation tool that is a part of G Suite (developed by Google). In this course, you will see how to create a website using the new Google Sites interface. You will see how to use the different tools available to add content to your site like text, images and videos. You will also see how to embed other Google files directly into a page, like Google Docs, Slides, Sheets, Charts and Forms. Google Sites also allows you to share your site with team members or coworkers so you can collaborate on your site together. You will see how to add editors to your site and how to manage the sharing settings for a given site. Finally, you will see how to publish and create the URL for your site as well as how to update your site if you need to make changes. You will also see how to unpublish and remove a site when you no longer need it.

subject.title: Cisco Jabber 11.8
subject.description: Cisco Jabber is an online and telephone communication tool. Learn how use Jabber's various tools, from simple instant chat messaging to video conferences and online meetings. Emoticons, mentions and call icons with help animate you conversations. You will also see how to create virtual meetings, share documents and use different collaboration tools. See how to integrate you email calendar to sync your planned meetings with Jabber.

subject.title: Facebook Pages
subject.description: Facebook Pages allows you to create a professional Page to promote and present your business, brand, or charity, etc. You can share information by with different types of posts, such as status, photo, live videos, events that your Page's visitors can react to. Inviting friends on Facebook to like your Page and choosing your preferred audience settings are also possibilities to reach your target audience and get better visibility for you Page.You can also check your Page's performance by opening the insights for your Page to see the different data about your Page's views, likes, followers and much more. This information can help you to promote your Page and increase its activity and popularity.

subject.title: iOS 11
subject.description: iOS 11 is Apple's mobile operating system, available for iPad and iPhone. In this course you'll see new features such as multitasking as well as new messaging and note sharing options. See how to use you Apple accessories such as the Apple Pencil and Smart Keyboard with your iPad Pro. Discover, use, and get familiar with all that iOS 11 has to offer to help make your everyday usage easier.

subject.title: Microsoft Forms
subject.description: Microsoft Forms is an Office 365 application that allows you to create and customize different types of forms and quizzes. When you create a form, you can share it by using any internet browser and invite people to answer the questions and submit their responses. Responses can be submitted from computers and mobile devices with an internet connection. Responses to your forms and quizzes are sent directly to the application and can be found in a specific tab. When creating a quiz Microsoft Forms gives you additional options, such as adding answers and question feedback, as well as publishing responders scores.To analyze the response results further you can download them from the application as an Excel document and export the information as a PDF or CSV document.

subject.title: Circuit
subject.description: Circuit is an online collaboration platform. You will be able to communicate with your colleagues quickly and easily, whether by chat, audio call or video call.You will be able to create, organize and schedule a conference easily. You can then decide who can participate by adding contacts.In a conversation or conference, the tools available will allow you to share your screen or even share files from your desktop or from an external application, by connecting with one of the extensions available with Circuit .

subject.title: PowerPoint for iPhone
subject.description: This course covers all the features offered on PowerPoint for iPhone. As part of the Microsoft Office Suite that was released for use on mobile devices, the application makes it easy to view and modify PowerPoint presentations when you're on the go. You can even access presentations you've saved in OneDrive, Microsoft SharePoint or DropBox.You can also create new Powerpoint presentations with the help of the application. This course will cover how to create presentations and how to add details such as images, videos and tables. You'll also learn how to apply themes so that you can create customized presentations. After learning how to work on saved and newly created presentations, you'll learn how to share them.

subject.title: Android 8.0
subject.description: Android 8.0 is called Oreo, which is an operating system you can use on your tablet or smartphone. In this course, you will discover new features and become familiar with the Android user interface. You will also see how to access your emails, contacts, and multimedia with your touchscreen device. You'll learn how to sync your Google account and access the different apps Google has to offer without having to enter your account information every time. In this way, you can easily access your photos, videos, music and read the news topics that interest you.It is important to know who to configure your Android device to personalize its interface or be able to manage the notifications you receive.In this course, you will also learn how to use Android 8 to communicate with your different contacts by call, email or text message from your smartphone.

subject.title: Google Analytics
subject.description: Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google that tracks and reports website traffic. Whether you're managing a single website for a small business or multiple websites for a large corporation, Google Analytics can help you find out how your website is performing. In this course, you'll see how to set up your Google Analytics account, create and interpret reports as well how to manage multiple users or accounts. Get familiar with the fundamentals of creating reports, tracking goals and sharing your website's performance with Google Analytics.

subject.title: Twitter for Professionals
subject.description: Twitter is a social networking service that has only gained in popularity since its creation in 2006. It is used worldwide and has proved to be an effective marketing tool for businesses and brands. Twitter even makes specific tools available like Twitter Analytics to help users analyze the reach and visibility of their Tweets. Users can also sign up for Twitter Ads to create promotional Tweets and ad campaigns to promote their company, product or service. In this course, you will see the different ways to interact with your followers by adding certain business features to your profile such as a call-to-action link. You will see how to create a Twitter chat and use polls to pique your audience's interest and improve your presence on Twitter.You will also see how to analyze the different dashboards located in Twitter Analytics, which will help you understand how your followers use Twitter. Understanding these different metrics will allow you to adjust and improve your marketing strategy to cater to your followers' interests and behaviors in order to build your audience and gain new customers.

subject.title: Jive-n
subject.description: Jive-n is a social networking intranet platform that allows you to stay on top of the news in your company, your departments as well as your projects. Once you become familiar with the platform layout, you'll see how to create, publish and interact with content. You will also see how to collaborate and communicate with others users to complete tasks and work together on projects.  See how to communicate with other users via comments or private messages from your notification inbox. Lastly, you will also see how to manage your notifications as well as your Jive-n account settings.

subject.title: Google AdWords
subject.description: Google AdWords is an online advertising service developed by Google, where advertisers pay to display brief advertising copy, product listings within the Google ad network to web users. This course covers how to create and manage search or display campaigns. You'll also see how to add and manage your keywords as well as analyze their performance to target your audience.In addition to managing your campaigns, you can also manage additional account users, link additional Google products as well as share reports or download dashboards. With this course, you'll have a basic understanding of how to create and use your Google AdWords account.

subject.title: Dynamics 365 Sales
subject.description: Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a customer relationship management application and offers several different applications that you can use depending on your specific business needs. This course focuses on the Sales application, which will help you better understand your sales performance and customer needs. With the Sales application, you will be able to get various data intelligence on customer records, transactions, behaviors and preferences as well as information regarding orders and inventory.In this course, you will see how to access the different record types, how to analyze them and how to create new ones. You will also see how to create charts and import and export data to and from Dynamics as well as how to run reports on your sales performance data.You will also see how to schedule appointments, create tasks and use the Activities area to keep your sales team up to date.

subject.title: Salesforce Lightning 2018
subject.description: Salesforce Lightning is a CRM that manages the sales activities of a company. First, you will discover the interface and how to get around the platform. You will also see how to manage the sales process: create leads, track the progress of your business as well as update your opportunities and accounts. Stay on top of your work by creating tasks, planning events and communicating via email directly from Salesforce.Analyze your sales by running reports and creating dashboards. With specific permission, you can also manage the display and assign leads to your team.

subject.title: Microsoft Flow
subject.description: Microsoft Flow is an online application that helps you create automated workflows between your favorite applications and services to synchronize files, get notifications, collect data, and more.To access Flow, sign in with your Microsoft Office 365 account and get started creating and managing your flows. See how to create and customize your flows by integrating Microsoft application as well as third-party services. The principle is simple: define actions initiated by a trigger and connect the different applications via connectors offered by Flow.When you can create a flow from scratch go further by specifying conditions for creating complex flows, which include approvals by your managers or simultaneous actions.You will see that it is also possible to create scheduled flows that will automatically do an action for you at the times you indicate.Finally, learn how to manage all these flows, assign them to your employees as well as save or share them with others.

subject.title: Smartsheet
subject.description: Smartsheet is a collaboration and project management platform where you can create project timelines, documents, calendars, tasks and more. Discover and use the straightforward interface which enables to create, share and import existing documents from other services such as Microsoft and Google.You can work in real-time with your collaborators by sharing sheets, communicating through discussions and comments. Workspaces allow you to create teams and manage documents in a shared location where everyone can find what they need. Create new projects easily by browsing Smartsheet's template gallery.

subject.title: Microsoft To-Do
subject.description: Microsoft To-Do is a task management app available as a standalone service or as part of Office 365. You can use Microsoft To-Do to manage your tasks and priority lists across different devices, and even sync it with your Outlook tasks. There are two key parts to To-Do: your task lists, and My Day, which can suggest to-dos for you to complete in order to help you organize your day's activities. To-dos can be added to lists, given deadlines and reminders, and even broken down into steps and sub-tasks. You will also find out how to add notes, move tasks from one list to another, and share your lists with other users.

subject.title: Webex Meetings
subject.description: Webex Meetings is an online platform that allows you to organize meetings in a virtual meeting room. You can then configure your meeting room with the different options offered by Webex. By downloading the Webex plugin, you can quickly set up a meeting by inviting the different participants using their email address or their phone number. You can also choose to schedule a meeting and send details to your colleagues, such as the meeting room link and access code.During a meeting, you can assign roles to the participants so they can take the control and head the meeting. You can also choose to share documents during a meeting and use virtual whiteboards to annotate them if you wish. Once the meeting is over, you and your coworkers have the option of saving any shared documents on your computer. You can communicate in different ways during a meeting. For example, you can send messages with the chat tool, call, or use your computer's webcam. Webex Meetings also allows you to record your meetings so that you can keep a copy on the platform or on your computer.

subject.title: Webex Teams
subject.description: The Webex Teams application allows you to collaborate with your colleagues in various ways. You can create private and group conversations and use the instant messenger tool to chat in real-time. You can also call people by phone or using your device's microphone and webcam. Webex Teams also lets you create, organize and schedule virtual meetings and manage the meetings' participants. During a meeting, you have the option of sharing information by sharing a file or sharing your screen. Snapshots of files and your screen can be created and annotated. To be able to brainstorm ideas you can create whiteboards to annotate and share with other people. Finally, you have the option of grouping multiple spaces into one team. As moderator of a team you can add and remove members, and spaces from a Team and manage the moderator settings. Webex Teams also allows you to configure the application settings to best suit your way of working.

subject.title: Asana
subject.description: Asana is a web and mobile application designed to help teams organize, track, and manage their work. It helps teams manage projects and tasks in one tool. Teams can create projects, assign work to teammates, specify deadlines, and communicate about tasks directly in Asana. In this course, you'll discover how to get around the application as well as create teams and projects to organize your workflow. You'll also see how to manage team members, communicate via conversations and map your project's progress with Asana.

subject.title: Office 365 Web Portal
subject.description: Office 365 is the range of subscription plans offered by Microsoft, giving you access to a suite of Office applications, cloud-based collaboration services, and online productivity tools. Find out how to sign in to the Office 365 web portal via your web browser, navigate around the different services, spaces, and apps, and how to get the most out of your subscription.

subject.title: Confluence
subject.description: As both a wiki software and a collaborative platform, Confluence enables you to create and manage multiple teams and projects at the same time.After learning the basics of navigating the platform, you will see how to create spaces as well as pages with customized content. For this, you will learn how to use the tools necessary for editing, sharing, and managing information. You will also how to incorporate mentions, macro elements and task reports for an optimal project management.If you are the administrator of the site, you will see how to customize your companies site to meet your needs. Set default options for your team and manage permissions for members or external users.

subject.title: Hootsuite
subject.description: Hootsuite is a social media management platform designed to help you manage your online presence across a variety of different services, including Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and YouTube. The platform is organized like a dashboard, giving you a clear view of your social media activities, posts, and content, what has been shared, and what is scheduled. You can use Hootsuite to develop your online presence, manage your or your organization's brand, or publicize your activities and products. Find out how to manage your accounts and social content via Hootsuite, control your feeds, share posts, videos, files, links, and messages, and schedule content for automated posting.

subject.title: Sketch
subject.description: Sketch is a vector-based design tool for macOS. This application enables you to create simple as well as complex graphic designs. Sketch's interface is intuitive and easy to use for creating new designs such as logos, icons and more.With this course, you will see how to get around and use Sketch design tools to create and customize your own projects. You will also see how to collaborate with others by using Sketch Cloud.

subject.title: iOS 12
subject.description: iOS 12 is Apple's mobile operating system, available for iPad and iPhone. In this course, you'll see new features such as Screen Time to manage the time you spend on your device or the new Shortcuts app which allows you to create your own shortcuts for the actions you use most. You'll also learn how to use your Apple accessories such as the Apple Pencil and Smart Keyboard with your iPad Pro. Discover, use, and get familiar with all that iOS 12 has to offer to help make your everyday usage easier.

subject.title: Excel 2019 for Windows
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Excel 2019, the spreadsheet application released as part of the updated Microsoft Office 2019 suite. Use Excel spreadsheets to organize a wide variety of different data types, including text, numbers, percentages, dates, monetary figures, and even hyperlinks. You can create tables, adjust their appearance, and easily filter and sort your data entries. Excel 2019 is especially useful for performing calculations with your data. Take advantage of a huge library of formulas and functions. These can be used to perform calculations with varying degrees of complexity. You can incorporate conditions, apply different methods of analysis, and even extract individual cell elements to be used elsewhere in your spreadsheet. Excel 2019 also features a whole suite of collaboration tools for improved shared working practices. You can send your documents via email, protect them and convert them into different file formats, and even upload them to your cloud storage space. Shared access to these documents can also be activated, and access links can be created with ease. Direct communication other users is also optimized, with updated comments and change tracking tools in Excel 2019.

subject.title: Excel Office 365 for Windows
subject.description: This series of tutorials covers Microsoft Excel for Office 365, the spreadsheet application released as part of the updated Microsoft Office 365 suite. Use Excel spreadsheets to organize a wide variety of different data types, including text, numbers, percentages, dates, monetary figures, and even hyperlinks. You can create tables, adjust their appearance, and easily filter and sort your data entries. Excel for Office 365 is especially useful for performing calculations with your data. Take advantage of a huge library of formulas and functions. These can be used to perform calculations with varying degrees of complexity. You can incorporate conditions, apply different methods of analysis, and even extract individual cell elements to be used elsewhere in your spreadsheet. Excel for Office 365 also features a whole suite of collaboration tools for improved shared working practices. You can send your documents via email, protect them and convert them into different file formats, and even upload them to your cloud storage space. Shared access to these documents can also be activated, and access links can be created with ease. Direct communication other users are also optimized, with updated comments and change tracking tools in Excel for Office 365.
